Name: BrewDog Paradox Jura
Description: A very interesting little beer from BrewDog, Paradox is aged in whisky casks that previously held Isle of Jura whisky!

Name: BrewDog Tokyo
Description: A very potent, powerful Imperial Stout from BrewDog, this stuff comes out of the bottle thick and syrupy and black as the Ace of Spades.

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:08
Description: A very unusual beer, this is a \"Deconstructed Blonde Imperial Stout\" from BrewDog, inspired by a historical style of beer made by Georgian brewers.

Name: BrewDog Tactical Nuclear Penguin (37.5cl)
Description: First released as the world's strongest beer, this is a completely insane product from the equally bonkers chaps at BrewDog.

Name: BrewDog Lost Dog
Description: A lovely Imperial Porter created by BrewDog in collaboration with the Lost Abbey brewery. This tasty Porter was aged in a rum barrel for added richness and sweetness!

Name: BrewDog Bitch Please
Description: A delicious barley wine created by a collaboration (or \"collabo\" as they call them in the \"biz\") of BrewDog and Three Floyds, this is made with malts including Laphroaig whisky malt, single hopped

Name: BrewDog Anarchist Alchemist
Description: A triple, yes, triple hopped IPA that separates the sheep from the goats. Not that you should offer this to either even-toed ungulate, as it's 14% abv.

Name: Bowmore Bourbon Cask Ale - Feis Ile 2012
Description: Islay ales have used the grist from Bowmore to brew their beer, then matured the result it in an ex-bourbon barrel that previously housed Bowmore whisky.

Name: Never Mind The Anabolics - Brewdog
Description: Indie brewers, Brewdog, were enraged to discover that the drinks provided for that big sports-day in London 2012 were all from big commercial brands selling uninspiring beer that didn't seem in

Name: Ghost Deer
Description: Ghost Deer is the strongest fermented beer ever made at a whopping 28% abv. This means it was fermented to this strength (no freezing the beer and scooping out the frozen water shenanigans).

Name: BrewDog Paradox Isle of Arran
Description: When two great entities team up, you know the end product is always going to be amazing, just like when David Bowie and Queen made a song together.

Name: BrewDog Christmas Paradox 2012
Description: For a time that is meant to be harmonious and happy, Christmas isn't half stressful.

Name: BrewDog 5AM Saint
Description: AKA 'Five AM Red Ale', except this notional red ale is made by BrewDog and is heavily hopped! It's made with Extra Pale, Caramalt, Munich, Crystal and Dark Crystal malts.

Name: BrewDog Punk IPA
Description: As BrewDog themselves put it, Punk IPA is a 'Post Modern Classic', made with plenty of fruity hops to impart notes of tropical fruit alongside caramel and toffee on the palate and a traditional bitter

Name: BrewDog Black Tokyo Horizon
Description: Black Tokyo Horizon is a collaborative beer from Brew Dog, Mikkeller and Nogne O.

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:14
Description: Part of BrewDog's Abstrakt brand, which tend to be just a little more \"boundary-pushing\" than BrewDog's already radical catalogue.

Name: BrewDog Libertine Black Ale
Description: Somewhat of a mid-ground between an IPA and a stout, the BrewDog Libertine Black Ale is packed with hops while maintaining a rich, decadent mouth feel, along with all the other goodies that tasty

Name: BrewDog Hardcore IPA
Description: The Hardcore IPA from BrewDog is a big, bold and boisterous beer. It's intense, it's in your face, it's pretty much incredible. It'd probably listen to its music way too loud if it was a person.

Name: BrewDog Dogma
Description: The BrewDog Dogma is made with 10 different types of malt all blended together with Scottish heather honey, resulting in a supremely smooth sip.

Name: BrewDog Jack Hammer
Description: As subtle as a power drill, the BrewDog Jack Hammer IPA is plenty bitter, and that's just how they like it up at the Scottish brewery.

Name: BrewDog Electric India 6.5%
Description: BrewDog's Electric India is crafted using an already-hoppy Saison, which is brewed with orange peel, heather honey, crushed black pepper corns and hopped some more with lots of amarillo and nelson

Name: BrewDog & Victory U-Boat
Description: A collaboration between BrewDog up in Scotland and Victory Brewing over in Pennsylvania, USA.

Name: BrewDog #Mashtag 2014 - Democratic Imperial Red Ale
Description: A beer for the people, by the people (and BrewDog, of course).

Name: BrewDog & Mikkeller I Hardcore You
Description: A collaborative beer by BrewDog and Mikkeller, combining the Hardcore IPA with I Beat You, both of which are rather hoppy. Following the blending, they dry hop it. You know, to make it more hoppy.

Name: BrewDog Cocoa Psycho
Description: A decidedly decadent beer from BrewDog. Judging by the name alone, take a punt at what flavours you think you're going to find in this Imperial Russian Stout. Go on, have a guess.

Name: BrewDog Black Jacques
Description: Ah yes, one of them there BrewDog beers! Black Jacques is an Imperial Black Saison which has slumbered in red wine barrels for 9 months. It's a brilliant, bizarre beast to say the least - lovely job!

Name: BrewDog Everyday Anarchy
Description: A rambunctious Imperial Saison which has been aged in white wine barrels by that boisterous BrewDog bunch. The label is really something to behold indeed.

Name: BrewDog Mixtape 8
Description: BrewDog combine two oak-aged beers to create Mixtape 8. In the blue corner, you'll fine a Triple India Pale Ale. In the red corner, there's a hopped up Belgian Tripel.

Name: BrewDog Paradox Heaven Hill
Description: One of the BrewDog Paradox beers! Aces! This one is an imperial stout which has been aged in Heaven Hill bourbon barrels, giving this little rascal oodles of flavour.

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:16
Description: One of the experimental beers in BrewDog's Abstrakt range. In fact, they're up to number 16 now! AB:16 is a gorgeously rich Belgian Quad which has been infused with coffee beans. Superb stuff.

Name: Einstök Icelandic White Ale
Description: Einstök brew their beers with pure Icelandic water and this witbier was made with Bavarian noble hops, wheat malt and pilsner malts, oats, coriander and orange peel.\r\n\r\nOut of stock?

Name: Einstök Icelandic Arctic Ale
Description: Einstök Ölgerð. Icelandic, they are. This is their 'Viking' Pale Ale made with Cascade and Northern Brewer hops.

Name: Einstök Icelandic Toasted Porter
Description: A Porter from Einstök Ölgerð brewed with a soupçon of Icelandic roasted coffee alongside lager malt, Munich malt, chocolate malt and Bavarian hops.

Name: Einstök Icelandic Doppelbock
Description: A seasonal Doppelbock from the incredible Icelandic brewers, Einstök! Delicious stuff, perfect for the winter months.

Name: BrewDog This.Is.Lager.
Description: Madness? This. Is. Lager. It. Is. From. BrewDog. Ok, we're not going to do that this whole time, but you get the idea. This.Is.Lager.

Name: BrewDog Brixton Porter
Description: A classic from BrewDog's selection of ace beers, the Brixton Porter is plenty chocolatey and rich, but that's not the only string on its bow - there's also lighter hints of orchard fruit and aromatic

Name: BrewDog Konnichiwa Kitsune
Description: Part of BrewDog's Hello My Name Is...

Name: BrewDog Pumpkinhead
Description: BrewDog Pumpkinhead is an autumnal treat, which has been spiced with clove, ginger, star anise, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice and grains of paradise.

Name: BrewDog Dog C
Description: Dog C was released to mark 7 years of BrewDog beers. Cheers! Immensely rich and flavoursome, Dog C is an imperial stout which is brewed with cacao, coffee and Naga chilli.

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt Ab:17
Description: From BrewDog's Abstrakt range comes Ab:17, a 'three coffee rye imperial porter', which is made with espresso in the mash, cafetiere in the boil and whole roast beans in the whirlpool and the

Name: Harviestoun Ola Dubh 12 Special Reserve
Description: A very special ale from the Harviestoun Brewery, this was aged in casks which previously held Highland Park 12 year old! Now that's an ale!

Name: Harviestoun Ola Dubh 16 Special Reserve
Description: This Ola Dubh is a very good quality ale matured in casks whisky previously held 16 year old Highland Park, the result is a fabulous drink.

Name: Harviestoun Ola Dubh 18 Special Reserve
Description: An ale with a difference. Ola Dubh is ale that was aged in whisky casks, and casks from Highland Park no less. This particular ale was aged in casks which previously held 18 year old Highland Park!

Name: Harviestoun Ola Dubh 30 Special Reserve
Description: Ola Dubh is fantastic ale from Harviestoun, aged in casks whisky previously held Highland Park single malt!

Name: Harviestoun Ola Dubh 40 Special Reserve
Description: An artisan beer from Harviestoun, Ola Dubh 40 was aged in casks which previously housed 40 year old Highland Park - it really is the beer with a difference...

Name: Meantime London Porter
Description: A big, full bodied London Porter from Meantime in Greenwich. This is a bottle conditioned beer which will improve with age because it contains fast and slow acting yeasts.

Name: Meantime Pale Ale
Description: A very special pale ale from Meantime made with English Goldings and American Cascade and Cluster hops for added bitterness.

Name: Meantime Coffee Porter
Description: A Coffee flavoured Porter from Meantime in Greenwich. This won a Gold Medal for Coffee Beer at the 2006 World Beer Cup.

Name: Meantime India Pale Ale
Description: A full sized bottle of India Pale Ale made with Goldings and Fuggles hops. This is made with as many hops as they can physically fit into the copper, this really is a unique, full-bodied IPA!

Name: Meantime London Pale Ale
Description: An incredible London Pale Ale made in small batches in Greenwich with English Goldings and American Cascade and Cluster hops. This is made using Meantime's own dry hopping technique.

Name: BrewDog Vagabond Pale Ale
Description: BrewDog's Vagabond Pale Ale is a tasty beer made with Extra Pale, Cara and Crystal Malts, as well as Centennial and Amarillo hops, Scottish water and their clean-fermenting house yeast.

Name: BrewDog Sink The Bismarck! (37.5cl)
Description: Blimey. While BrewDog previously held the world record for strongest beer with their Tactical Nuclear Penguin, it was soon overtaken by a beer weighing in a 40% ABV.

Name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek
Description: A Belgian Kriek lambic from Beersel, close to Brussels. Cherries are added for 6 to 8 months with a further 4 months in the bottle before release.

Name: Brew By Numbers 03|03 Porter (Traditional)
Description: With Brew By Numbers, the first number refers to the beer style (3 - Porter) and the second refers to the recipe within that beer style (3 - Traditional).

Name: Brew By Numbers 12|05 Barrel Aged Tripel
Description: A Belgian-style Tripel aged in ex-Chardonnay white wine barrels and bottle-conditioned for a further nine months. In fact, this Barrel Aged (12) Tripel (05) is an oak matured version of 14|01 i.e.

Name: Beavertown 8 Ball Rye IPA
Description: Beavertown's moment of Americana as they pay homage to the big US IPAs. Rye and Crystal Rye (Rye-PA?

Name: Beavertown Neck Oil
Description: Beavertown's ultimate session beer, designed to be perfect at any time, even \"from 8am in the morning\"!

Name: Beavertown Gamma Ray American Pale Ale
Description: Made with Best Pale, Caragold and Caramalt malts as well as Colombus, Bravo, Amarillo, Citra and Calypso hops (dry-hopped for days), this is a deliciously drinkable offering from popular craft

Name: Beavertown Holy Cowbell India Stout
Description: Taking the Cockney version of De Beauvoir Town for their name, these London brewers (now based in Tottenham Hale) continue to produce top beers such as this India Stout or 'Hopped Stout'.

Name: Beavertown Black Betty IPA
Description: Woah! A Black IPA made with Carafa II & III malts for the roasty dark character (alongside Best Pale, Caragold and Caramalt) with Colombus, Chinook and Citra hops.

Name: Black Isle Organic Blonde
Description: Black Isle's Blonde is a premium craft lager that shares its character with a pale ale, made with organic Hallertau Aroma hops from New Zealand resulting in a continental (European) feel.

Name: Black Isle Organic Goldeneye Pale Ale
Description: Goldeneye! We've found your weakness. Classic pale ale from Black Isle brewery made with wheat, pale ale and crystal malts. Dum, dum dum dum - sing it Tina!

Name: Black Isle Organic Hibernator Oatmeal Stout
Description: An organic stout from Black Isle brewery made with Pale and Chocolate malts, unmalted oats and English First Golding hops.

Name: Black Isle Organic Pollinator
Description: A light golden/blonde Black Isle beer brewed with heather honey! What's more, Black Isle donate 10p from each sale to The Bumble Bee Conservation Trust to support their important work.

Name: Black Isle Organic Red Kite Amber Ale
Description: An amber ale from Black Isle that shares its name with a bird of prey. Made with British hops, the brewery suggest enjoying it alongside a winter stew or paired with Glenmorangie 18 Year Old...

Name: Black Isle Citra Saison
Description: Farmhouse ale brewed with Citra hops in Scotland by Black Isle!

Name: Black Isle Berliner Weisse
Description: A traditional sour Berliner Weisse from Black Isle Brewing in the Scottish Highlands. The brewers recommend trying this one with a dash of elderflower cordial.

Name: The Bruery Mischief
Description: A Belgian-style Golden Ale that's purportedly up to no good from the Famille Rue aka The Bruery. It is, you see, dry hopped with American hops.

Name: Bruery Terreux Tart of Darkness
Description: Tart of Darkness. Quite a name! Naturally, it refers to the fact that this is a sour stout. Why, what were you thinking?

Name: Bruery Terreux Sour In The Rye
Description: An American wild ale from Bruery Terreux, a dedicated brand from The Bruery for these kinds of great beers. It's made with a high proportion of rye malt and matured in oak barrels for over a year.

Name: Bruery Terreux Beret
Description: A princely raspberry beret of a sour witbier (made with pureed raspberries) from The Bruery in California.

Name: The Bruery Autumn Maple Brown Ale
Description: The Buery's take on the ol' seasonal pumpkin ale, they eschewed the squash cultivar in favour of the yam!

Name: Cloudwater Brown Ale (Winter Range)
Description: A seasonal brown ale from Manchester's Cloudwater Brew Co. made with Australian and American hops.

Name: Cloudwater Porter (Autumn Range)
Description: A Porter from Cloudwater's Autumn range produced at their home in Manchester, not far from the Piccadilly railway station.

Name: Cloudwater Small Beer - Hibernate (Special Edition)
Description: A Special Edition Stout from Cloudwater Brew Co. release to mark their 100th brew! Ironically named, it's made from the second runnings of an Imperial Stout.

Name: Crooked Stave Progenitor
Description:
"Progenitor
1. Dry hopped golden sour ale
2. Ancestral form from which others derived"

A fantastic sour ale from the Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project in Denver, Colorado.

Name: Crooked Stave Colorado Wild Sage
Description: From the Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project in Denver comes this Brett Saison brewed with wild white sage and lemongrass!

Name: Evil Twin Citra Sunshine Slacker
Description: A slacker doesn't sound like the perfect thing to base a beer's character on, but Evil Twin make a compelling case:\r\n\r\n\"Despite his bitterness, lack of power and insuperable aversion to any kind of

Name: Evil Twin Femme Fatale Blanc
Description: An Evil Twin American IPA made with Nelson Sauvin hops and fermented with Brettanomyces at Westbrook Brewing Co., South Carolina.

Name: Evil Twin Femme Fatale Noir
Description: A Bretted Black IPA (fermented with Brettanomyces) from Evil Twin's Femme Fatale series.

Name: Evil Twin Femme Fatale Sudachi
Description: The Femme Fatale beers from Evil Twin are all fermented with brettanomyces. A genus of yeast that takes its name from the Greek for 'British fungus', you can call it simply call it Brett.

Name: Evil Twin Femme Fatale Kabosu
Description: The Femme Fatale series pays tribute to the labour of love a new brew can become for its potentially obsessed creators! This India Pale Ale comes from Westbrook Brewing Co.

Name: Evil Twin Freudian Slip
Description: As far as names for no nonsense, saying it how it is beers go, it doesn't get much better. A tremendous  Evil Twin barley wine brewed at Two Roads Brewing Co., Connecticut.

Name: Evil Twin Hipster Ale
Description: A beer for the global hipster, the hipster beer without borders, just in case you don't happen to live in the kind of happening cities that may have been the subject of some other 'hip' releases.

Name: Evil Twin Hop Flood
Description: An Amber Ale from Evil Twin (brewed by Two Roads in Connecticut), that's their \"bitter tribute to the heroic bottles that didn’t make it\" following flooding in Copenhagen (and in particular the

Name: Evil Twin Lil' B
Description: An Imperial Porter brewed at Two Roads Brewing Co., Connecticut and bottled by Evil Twin who continue to provide us with fantastic beers from ten top breweries around the world.

Name: Evil Twin Même Jésus Plus
Description: An Imperial Stout with cocoa nibs added from everybody's favourite Evil Twin (brewed at Westbrook Brewing in South Carolina).

Name: Evil Twin Ryan and the Beaster Bunny
Description: A seasonal (saisonal?) beer first thought up by Evil Twin on the island of Fanø off the west coast of Denmark.

Name: Evil Twin Soft DK
Description: Hey, why's that beer called Soft DK? Well according to Evil Twin \"This stout looks like soft dookie and some will say it smells and tastes like it too.

Name: Evil Twin Christmas Eve at a New York City Hotel Room
Description: A 'festive' Imperial Stout brewed for the excellent Evil Twin at Two Roads brewery in Connecticut and bottled at a punchy 10% abv!

Name: Evil Twin Yang
Description: Evil Twin have produced two beers that when combined create their very own Black & Tan (made by mixing pale and dark beer). They go together like Yin & Yang and that's exactly what they're called!

Name: Evil Twin Yin
Description: An Imperial Taiji Stout described by Evil Twin (who sound like they know a thing or two about the subject) as \"profoundly evil\".

Name: Greenbrew Monsieur Rock
Description: A blonde bottle fermented 'Belgian' beer made with Pilsner malt that at the time of writing is actually brewed at Meantime in Greenwich whilst they await the construction of their own brewery in

Name: Green Flash Le Freak
Description: A Belgian-style Imperial IPA - part Belgian-Style Tripel, part American Imperial IPA! Amarillo dry-hopped and bottle-conditioned - Le Freak, c'est chic! Perfect for good times.

Name: Green Flash Imperial IPA
Description: A high gravity imperial heavily hopped with Nugget and Summit for a 'San Diego-style IPA'.

Name: Green Flash Hop Head Red
Description: A combination of Double IPA and Red Ale styles made with Warrior and Nugget hops and dry hopped with Amarillo by Green Flash Brewing Co. from San Diego, California.

Name: Harviestoun Raspy Engine
Description: A Harviestoun Old Engine Oil Porter (made with Washington Galena, Worcester Fuggles and Kent Goldings hops) infused with Scottish raspberries!

Name: Hitachino Nest Japanese Classic Ale
Description: A bottle-conditioned Japanese ale made with Chinook, Fuggle and Kent Golding hops alongside Marris Otter, Munich and Crystal malts. It's matured in cedar oak.

Name: Hitachino Nest Saison Du Japon
Description: A Saison from Japanese brewery Kiuchi made with local wheat, koji-kin (malted rice, as used in sake) and yuzu juice (added at the very end of the fermentation, which takes place with sake yeast and

Name: Hop Concept Lemon & Grassy (Hop Freshener Series)
Description: A seasonal IPA brewed with lemon zest as well as Galena, Brewers Gold, Comet, Lemon Drop, Nelson and Sorachi Ace hops. Part of Hop Concept's Hop Freshener Series from the folk behind Port Brewing Co.

Name: Kees Farmhouse IPA
Description: From Brouwerij Kees comes a farmhouse tribute beer.

Name: Kees Just Another IPA
Description: An IPA (another one!) from Kees in Middelburg, the Netherlands made with Kahatu and\r\nMotueka hops from New Zealand alongside wheat and English Marris Otter malts.

Name: Kees & Magic Rock - Brewed With Friends #1
Description: Brouwerij Kees 'collabo' number one is with Magic Rock and is brewed with blackberries, blackcurrant, oranges, apple, cinnamon, star anise and vanilla!

Name: Mikkeller All Others Pale's Pale
Description:

Henry & Sally arrive at the bar. Sally orders a pale ale. She takes a sip. Then another.

Henry: “How is it?

Name: Mikkeller Amass B&W
Description: A West Coast Style IPA created for American Matt Orlando's Amass restaurant in Copenhagen and brewed at D’Proef in Belgium. A truly international beer!

Name: Mikkeller Gravøl - Death is not the end!
Description: Gravøl translates roughly as 'memorial', but it's more of a celebratory, traditional Norse funeral feast where - if it was the man of the house that had died - a ceremonial beer would be drunk by the

Name: Mikkeller Milk Stout
Description: Milk stout is awesome stuff made using lactose sugar, which can't be fermented by beer yeast. This craft release from Mikkel Borg Bjergsø's excellent Mikkeller is no exception.

Name: Mikkeller Nuclear Hop Assault
Description: This double Imperial India Pale Ale from Mikkeller is made with hybrid hops as a tribute to the metal band of the same name and was actually brewed at D’Proef in Belgium.

Name: Mikkeller Oktoberpretzel
Description: Oktoberfestbier and pretzels, the perfect combination. What if you could have an Oktoberfestbier style beer that's actually brewed with pretzels, though? Two birds with one stone!

Name: Mikkeller Vesterbro Brown
Description: Originally a Mikkeller Bar house beer, this cracking Brown Ale is now available in bottles! Brewed at D’Proef in Belgium.

Name: Mikkeller Vesterbro Wit
Description: A house beer at the Mikkeller bar in Vesterbro, Copenhagen, which is brewed at D’Proef in Belgium.

Name: Mikkeller Wheat Is The New Hops
Description: An IPA made with wheat and fermented with brettanomyces at D’Proef brewery in Belgium for Mikkeller.

Name: Moa Southern Alps White IPA
Description: A fusion of Belgian Wit and IPA from Moa (say 'more') Brewing Company in New Zealand made with Nelson Sauvin and Citra hops as well as Vienna and Pale Wheat malts.

Name: Moa Imperial Stout
Description: A French oak aged Stout from New Zealand hopped to over 100 IBUs. This is one you could cellar.

Name: Moa St Josephs Belgian Tripel
Description: A Belgian-style Tripel from Marlborough, New Zealand! Moa, pronounced 'more', is the award winning craft beer company founded by Josh Scott, the son of Marlborough winemaker Allan Scott.

Name: Moa Five Hop English Ale
Description: English-style ale from Marlborough, New Zealand made with Cascade, Pacifica, Motueka, Hallertau and Nelson Sauvin hops.

Name: Moa Festive IPA Red Edition
Description: From Moa's Festive IPA Series comes a red IPA, featuring Simcoe and Amarillo hops.

Name: Moor Beer Company So'Hop
Description: A very drinkable 'ultra pale ale' made with British floor malt and Southern hemisphere hops by the Moor Beer Co. The malt used was low coloured cara, allowing the hops to really shine.

Name: Moor Beer Company Nor'Hop
Description: Named Best English Style Pale & Bitter by Rate Beer, this is an 'ultra pale ale' from Moor Beer Co. made with British floor malt and a specially selected American (Northern hemisphere) hop.

Name: Moor Beer Company RAW
Description: RAW was created to be the house beer for the Real Ale Weston and Royal Artillery Arms pubs as a hoppier version of Moor Beer Co.'s Merlin's Magic bitter.

Name: Moor Beer Company Revival
Description: Moor Beer Company Revival is a 'Trans-Atlantic pale ale' from the South West UK-based brewery, made using a combination of pale, lager, cara, crystal and wheat malts, as well as a blend of American

Name: Moor Beer Company TFA
Description: TFA stands for Totally Fucking Awesome, an apt name for this Black IPA from Moor. When the company also has an English IPA called The Empire Strikes Back (geddit?

Name: Murray's Rudeboy Pilsner
Description: A rather special roundel-sporting beer from Murray's Craft Brewing Co. - \"'cause all other pilsners are mod-cons\". Nice.

Name: Murray's Angry Man Pale Ale
Description: This Australian American Pale Ale from Murray's Craft Brewing Co. is a knock-out cold. (Geddit?) American Centennial and New Zealand Motueka are used alongside British, German and Australian malts.

Name: Murray's FRED IPA
Description: An IPA from Murray's, whose tagline is simply \"No Boring Beer\".

Name: Mystic Mary of the Gael
Description: A Saison-Style Farmhouse Ale produced for St. Brigid’s Day, marking the start of Celtic spring. Pilsener and honey malt are used and this beer is liberally dry hopped.

Name: Mystic Table Beer
Description: Table beer, now there's an idea. Mystic, you have our full attention!

Name: Mystic Flor Ventus
Description: Unfiltered, unpasteurised and bottle conditioned wild (or sour) ale from Mystic barrel programme in Massachusetts, matured in French oak.

Name: Port Brewing Summer Pale Ale
Description: A seasonal West Coast-style pale ale made with Chinook, Cascade, Amarillo, and Simcoe hops.

Name: Prancing Pony Sunshine Ale
Description: An Australian blonde ale from Prancing Pony brewery in Totness, near Littlehapton, not far from Adelaide. It's made with 100% Pilsener malt, which is hopped six times with Citra.

Name: Prancing Pony India Red Ale
Description: A brewery in Australia? We thought the Prancing Pony was an inn in New Zealand!

Name: Prancing Pony Black Ale
Description: Blurring the lines between American Black Ale and American Stout this dark horse is black as the night, fire brewed and three times hopped.

Name: Pressure Drop Street Porter
Description: A fantastic porter made with traditional malts and Kentish hops that celebrates the hard-working Londoners who've enjoyed this style of beer for centuries.

Name: Samuel Adams Tetravis (Barrel Room Collection)
Description: A quad from Samuel Adams' excellent Barrel Room Collection made with Belgian yeast, Hallertauer Mittelfrüh hops and brewing sugar and bottle-conditioned with Champagne yeast.

Name: Samuel Adams American Kriek (Barrel Room Collection)
Description: A Samuel Adams take on a Belgian Kriek aged on Balaton cherries! It's made with Hallertau Mittelfrüh hops and the malts used are Samuel Adams' two-row pale blend, Caramel 60, Munich 10 and Special B.

Name: Samuel Adams New World Tripel (Barrel Room Collection)
Description: An oak aged Golden Tripel from Samuel Adams, made with Tettnang Tettnanger and Saaz hops as well as their their two-row pale malt blend and malted wheat.

Name: Samuel Adams Stony Brook Red (Barrel Room Collection)
Description: An oak aged ale from the Boston Beer Company's popular Samuel Adams range!

Name: Samuel Adams Thirteenth Hour Stout (Barrel Room Collection)
Description: This oak aged, spicy dark Belgian-style stout was called forth with thirteen ingredients  and named after the witching hour!

Name: Ska Modus Hoperandi
Description: A well-hopped USA-style IPA from Ska Brewing out in Durango, Colorado.

Name: St-Feuillien Saison
Description: A traditional farmhouse ale from southern Belgium, first launched in 2009 for the American market. Hoppy and Belgian with a secondary fermentation in the bottle, what's not to like?

Name: St-Feuillien Grand Cru
Description: A special edition extra-blond beer from top Belgian brewers St-Feuillien that undergoes re-fermentation in the bottle.

Name: St-Feuillien Cuvée De Noël 75cl
Description: St-Feuillien, reassuringly known as 'Old Faithful', is a top-fermenting Belgian beer.

Name: Stone & Wood Pacific Ale
Description: An unfiltered Australian beer from Stone & Wood of Byron Bay made with Australian barley, wheat and Galaxy hops.

Name: Vale Ale
Description: Vale Ale is a Pale Ale. Vale Pale Ale. It's made by Vale Brewing in Australia (not to be confused with Vale Brewery in Aylesbury) with Amarillo and Cascade hops as well as crystal malt.

Name: Vale IPA
Description: Said to be an Australian version of an American IPA, this beer from Vale Brewing is made with Galaxy (Australia), Nelson Sauvin (New Zealand) and Citra (USA) hops and pale, wheat and crystal malt.

Name: Westerham Bohemian Rhapsody
Description: A Czech-style Pilsner from Westerham Brewery in Kent made with Czech-grown Saaz hops and English lager malt. Fermented with a lager yeast and cold conditioned for 4 weeks.

Name: Beavertown Smog Rocket Smoked Porter
Description: A porter inspired by the industrial revolution, when smog filled the air and porter was still the drink of choice.

Name: Black Isle Barrel Aged Scotch Ale - Islay Edition
Description: Black Isle Brewing took their Scotch Ale, which they described as \"liquid fruitcake\" (and suggested pairing with Glenmorangie Lasanta) and aged it in a cask that previously held single malt whisky

Name: Buxton Brewery Deep Rainbow Valley
Description: A saison from Buxton Brewery made with soured orange juice and aged on gorse flowers.

Name: Buxton Brewery Jacob's Ladder
Description: A hoppy session beer brewed to support the Buxton Mountain Rescue Team (geddit? Mountains, climbing, ladders…), with a small amount donated for each and every sale.

Name: Buxton Brewery SPA
Description: A hoppy pale ale from Buxton Brewery, who certainly know a thing or two about this style historically. SPA is made with Citra hops from North America.

Name: Buxton Brewery Wild Boar IPA
Description: A bottle conditioned India Pale Ale from Buxton. Nice it is too.

Name: The Kernel Table Beer
Description: A tasty Table Beer from the folks at Kernel Brewery in Bermondsey, made with a differing selection of hop varieties for each batch. Good for pairing with food or enjoying on a summer afternoon.

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Chinook Zeus Citra
Description: The Kernel make beer with \"upfront hops, lingering bitternesses, warming alcohols, (and) bodies of malt.\" What's not to like? This pale ale is made with Citra, Zeus and Chinook hops, obviously.

Name: The Kernel Export India Porter (50cl)
Description: A larger 50cl bottle of The Kernel's hoppy and rich India Porter!

Name: The Kernel Export India Porter (33cl)
Description: An excellent bottle conditioned hoppy porter from The Kernel craft brewery in London.

Name: The Kernel Export Stout London 1890
Description: The Kernel Brewery in Bermondsey based the recipe for their Export Stout on that of a brew from 1890!

Name: Moor Beer Company Confidence Can
Description: A tasty canned red ale from the Moor Beer Co. in Somerset - the label says it is \"honouring those who inspire others\

Name: Moor Beer Company Dark Alliance
Description: An ace coffee stout here from the Moor Beer Co. in Somerset, originally created as a collaboration between Moor, Clifton Coffee Company and Arbor Ales.

Name: Tempest Harvest IPA
Description: From Tempest Brewing Co. in Tweedbank in the Scottish Borders comes the Tempest IPA, made using Mosaic hops along with a Belgian strain of yeast.

Name: Wiper and True Milk Shake Milk Stout
Description: A bottle conditioned milk stout brewed with Maris Otter Pale Ale malt plus some Chocolate malt, Crystal and Roasted Barley as well as vanilla and British hops at Ashley Down Brewery.

Name: Wiper and True Whitefriars
Description: A Belgian-style Winter Ale from Bristol's excellent Wiper and True.

Name: Anchorage Whiteout
Description: A Belgian-style witbier brewed with lemon peel, black peppercorns and coriander and then aged in ex-Chardonnay wine casks!

Name: Mikkeller American Dream
Description: A lager from Mikkeler, made using American hops. This one's intended to be drunk from the can after grabbing it from the fridge on a warm day.

Name: Mikkeller Black Hole
Description: An intense imperial stout, Black Hole is said to be \"what Mikkeller is all about\

Name: Mikkeller Hop On Drink'in Berliner
Description: A punchier, dry hopped version of Mikkeler's Drink'in Berliner, a Berliner Weisse.

Name: Mikkeller Say Sun
Description: A Belgian Saison Ale from Mikkeller, brewed at D'Proef.

Name: Mikkeller Belgian Tripel
Description: A Tripel style Belgian ale from the wonderful Mikkeller! A tasty treat which has been brewed with coriander and sweet orange zests, resulting in oodles of mouth-filling flavour. Love the label, too!

Name: Mikkeller USAlive!
Description: A strong Belgian-style beer from Mikkeller, made using wild yeasts which brings out a refreshing, juicy sourness to the brew.

Name: Mikkeller Wheat Is The New Hops Can
Description: A can of Mikkeler's wheat IPA fermented with brettanomyces at D’Proef in Belgium.

Name: To Øl Gose To Hollywood
Description: A gose made with Californian oranges! Pilsner, Biscuit, Cara Pils malts are used as well as malted and unmalted wheat. Refreshing on a summer's day.

Name: To Øl Jule Mælk
Description: Jule Mælk is To Øl's Imperial Milk Stout, sitting at a rather imposing 15% ABV. Somewhat Christmas-y, too...

Name: To Øl Releaf Me
Description: A wonderfully well-named Belgian Blonde Ale here from To Øl - Releaf Me is brewed with Thai lime leaves and well as Nelson Sauvin and Citra hops. Ought to pair well with spicy foods...

Name: To Øl Reparationsbajer
Description: A gluten free (and rather refreshing) pale ale from To Øl, made with generous helpings of American and New Zealand hops.

Name: To Øl Shameless Santa
Description: A big-bodied Belgian red ale from To Øl called Shameless Santa - great for enjoying during Christmas...

Name: To Øl Sofa King Pale
Description: A wonderfully well balanced session Pale Ale here from To Øl, made with a combination of Citra, Amarillo and Tettnanger hops.

Name: AleSmith Old Numbskull
Description: An American barley wine-style brew here from the AleSmith folks in San Diego!

Name: Almanac Farm to Barrel Dogpatch Sour
Description: Almanac are a team of brewers who enjoy combining classic beer styles with their own terroir of Northern California.

Name: Almanac Emperor Norton
Description: A Belgian Tripel style from Californian brewers, Almanac.

Name: Almanac Golden Gate Gose
Description: Almanac's Golden Gate Gose indeed captures all the intriguing flavour elements of the traditional German style of beer.

Name: Almanac Saison Dolores
Description: A San Francisco-inspired Saison here from Almanac Beer Co., made with barley, rye and wheat grown in Mendocino County.

Name: Against The Grain Little Did We Know
Description: A collaborative brew between Against the Grain Brewery in Kentucky and Baltimore's Stillwater, Little Did We Know is a surprising smoky saison featuring pecan and sage smoked malts and finished with

Name: Against The Grain Tall Tale
Description: An Against The Grain Brewery remix of a Stillwater Artisanal brew here!

Name: Black Market Sour Ale with Blackberries
Description: From the Black Market Brewing Co. in beautiful California, USA, comes their Blackberry Sour ale in an American 355ml can! Juicy and satisfyingly sour, with a fairly approachable ABV.

Name: Black Market Sour Ale with Cherries
Description: A cherry sour ale from Californian brewers, Black Market (in an American 355ml can).

Name: Black Market Deception
Description: A Californian Blonde-style beer from Black Market Brewing co., made with Saaz hops as well as coconut and lime.

Name: Crooked Stave St. Bretta Gold Nugget Mandarin
Description: From Brett beer specialists Crooked Stave in Colorado comes another edition of their St. Bretta wheat beer, this time brewed with gold nugget mandarin. This is a 375ml bottle.

Name: Crooked Stave Vieille
Description: An oak aged Saison from Colorado based brewers Crooked Stave, presented in a 375ml bottled.

Name: Jester King Commercial Suicide
Description: Texas brewer Jester King's Commercial Suicide is a rather interesting venture, drawn inspiration from both farmhouse ales and British milds!

Name: Jolly Pumpkin Bam Noire
Description: From Jolly Pumpkin's selection of artisan ales comes the Bam Noire, a dark sour ale which has been brewed with plenty of dark malts, wild yeasts and bottle conditioned.

Name: Jolly Pumpkin Luciérnaga
Description: Jolly Pumpkin's Luciernaga (which means Firefly) is a bit like a mix between Pale Ale and Saison, with plenty of Belgian inspiration being showed off.

Name: Jolly Pumpkin Oro de Calabaza
Description: A Belgian-inspired golden ale from Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales in Michigan, made with wild yeasts, giving it that oh-so-intriguing personality.

Name: Lost Abbey Santo Ron Diego
Description: From the Lost Abbey range, produced in California, comes the Santo Ron Diego!

Name: Moylan's Danny's Irish Style Red Ale
Description: Danny's Irish Red Ale comes to us via Moylan's Brewery in California. An enjoyably rich, malty, caramel-y brew which ought to compliment hearty meals handsomely.

Name: Moylan's Dragoons Dry Irish-Style Stout
Description: A Dry Irish Stout from Californian brewers, Moylan's. Using Willamette hops and a delicious selection of malts, this Stout is just the thing to enjoy on a long afternoon in the autumn.

Name: Moylan's Ryan Sullivan's Imperial Stout
Description: A big-bodied, marvellously malty Imperial Stout from Moylan's Brewery in beautiful Novato California. Huge notes of chocolate and coffee here. Rather awesomely, it was named for Moylans' St.

Name: Moylan's Tipperary Pale Ale
Description: From Moylan's Brewery in California comes their Tipperary Pale Ale, name after County Tipperary in Ireland.

Name: Oceanside Daliesque 2012
Description: An interesting American \"Barrel-aged Lambic style Belgian blonde\" here from California brewery, Oceanside Ale Works.

Name: Port Brewing Anniversary Ale
Description: A well-hopped and rather strong IPA from Port Brewing Company, made with a selection tasty hops along with a generous dry-hopping too.

Name: Prairie Brett C.
Description: Another excellent Saison-style brew here from Oklahoma-based Prairie Artisan Ale - Brett C is made with Citra and Cascade hops, and also features a little bit of sea salt in the mix, too!

Name: Prairie Funky Gold Mosaic
Description: Right, so what the Prairie Artisan Ale brewers have done here is they've taken their Prairie Gold sour ale and they've dry-hopped it with loads and loads of Mosaic hops!

Name: Prairie Gold
Description: A delicious, refreshing sour beer here from the Prairie Artisan Ales range, produced in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Name: Prairie Hop
Description: A Saison-style brew here from Oklahoma-based brewing folks, Prairie, with a particularly hop-driven flavour profile.

Name: Prairie Ale
Description: A Belgian-style Saison here from Prairie Artisan Ales in Oklahoma, USA. With wild yeasts and a generous helping of Saaz hops, this is a top-notch treat to enjoy on a warm Oklahoma afternoon...

Name: Ska Decadent Imperial IPA
Description: Originally brewed to celebrate Ska Brewing's 10th anniversary, their Decadent IPA is packed to the brim with fresh, fruity citrus-y hop notes and enjoyably well-balanced wafts of caramel malt.

Name: Stone Imperial Mutt Brown Ale
Description: Mutt Brown Ale from Stone Brewing in California, USA, was borne out of their in-house Spotlight Series brewing competition, created by Drew Neldon and Steve Via - top work, chaps!

Name: Stone Stochasticity Project - HiFi + LoFi Mixtape
Description: Part of the Stone Stochasticity Project, the HiFi + LoFi Mixtape harks back to the days when brewers would mix newly-brewed beer with cask-aged beer to make them more palatable.

Name: BrewDog Santa Paws
Description: A Christmas-themed Scotch ale from BrewDog, which has been brewed with heather honey, which imparts a rich, warming core to the beer.

Name: BrewDog Candy Kaiser
Description: \"Norddeutsches Retro Altbier\" is how BrewDog describe their Candy Kaiser - sounds pretty cool indeed.

Name: BrewDog Pumpkin King
Description: All rise for the king of the pumpkins! Kneel before his glowing eyes and toothsome grin! Pumpkin King is BrewDog's own take on the pumpkin ale, a classic autumnal treat.

Name: BrewDog Albino Squid Assassin
Description: A red rye IPA from the chaps at BrewDog, and a very stylish one at that!

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:19
Description: One of them there BrewDog beers from their experimental Absrakt range. For AB:19, what they've done is blend two different barrel-aged saisons, one red and one black.

Name: Brewdog Dog D
Description: Created in celebration of BrewDog's 8th anniversary, Dog D continues the theme of Dog C, being a delicious Imperial Stout. However, unlike previous beers in the series, Dog D has been barrel-aged!

Name: Mikkeller Black Ink & Blood Bourbon Barrel Aged
Description: A collaboration between top craft brewers Mikeller and their friends at Crooked Moon Tattoo in Sweden, Black Ink & Blood is an Imperial Stout which has been brewed with raspberries.

Name: Mikkeller 2012 Fra Til Via Grand Marnier Barrel Aged (37.5cl)
Description: A Christmas beer from the excellent Mikkeller brewers - it's an Imperial porter, and this one has been aged in Grand Marnier barrels too!

Name: Mikkeller Crooked Moon Stockholm Fig Stout
Description: Mikkeller brewed the Crooked Moon Stockholm Fig Stout for their friends at the Crooked Moon Tattoo Studio in Sweden.

Name: Mikkeller Til Fra Via
Description: An excellent stocking suffer for your beer-geek friends - a Christmas ale from the Mikkeller range. Look, it's even got a gift tag on the label with space to write the recipient's name and your own!

Name: Mikkeller Cucumber Witbier
Description: Oooh, a cucumber wheat beer, made as a collaboration between Mikkeller and I'm a KOMBO. The label even features a diagram showing you how to make your own cucumber garnish/bottle cap for the beer!

Name: Mikkeller It's Alight!
Description: It's Alight! is a well balanced Belgian beer from the wonderful Mikkeller range.

Name: Mikkeller K:rlek 8 Höst/Vinter 2015
Description: Fancy a beer with a label that features folks with a fine taste in headgear on it? Then Mikkeller's K:rlek 8 Höst/Vinter 2015 will suit your very, very specific needs.

Name: Mikkeller Monk's Brew
Description: Mikkeller have taken inspiration from the Trappist monasteries of Rochefort and Westvleteren for their Monk's Brew (a very apt name for sure).

Name: Mikkeller Nelson Sauvin
Description: From the excellent, inventive craft brewers Mikkeller comes their Nelson Sauvin, which has been fermented using wild yeasts and has been aged in white wine casks.

Name: Mikkeller Santa's Little Helper 2012 Tequila Barrel Aged
Description: A portion of Mikkeller's 2012 Santa's Little Helper was aged their tasty Christmas ale in tequila barrels! Exciting stuff for sure...

Name: Mikkeller Santa's Little Helper 2014
Description: Santa's Little Helper 2014 from Mikkeller is little only in name - it's a big-bodied Belgian dark ale bursting at the seems with yummy chocolatey goodness. A great beer for the chilly evening.

Name: Mikkeller U Alright?
Description: U Alright? comes to us from the excellent Mikkeller range - this one was produced at D'Proef in Belgium. It's a rather tasty sour beer which captures plenty of vibrant fruit notes at its core.

Name: Fourpure Amber Ale
Description: For their Amber Ale, the Fourpure Brewing Company in London took inspiration from a road trip in Colorado, USA.

Name: De Koninck APA (Antwaarpse Pale Ale)
Description: A pale ale from Antwerp with a playful name (it's not an APA). It's a highly drinkable Belgian beer with an amber hue.

Name: Hopus
Description: A hopped, malty, bitter blonde/pale ale from Brasserie Lefebvre in Quenast, Belgium. Serve thoroughly chilled and pour with a nice big head if you can.

Name: Pauwel Kwak
Description: It's Pauwel Kwak from Brouwerij Bosteels! Some say it was named after an 18th century innkeeper and brewer.

Name: Satan Red
Description: A ruby red Belgian ale from Brouwerij de Block's Satan range, which has its own hashtag (#SatanIsHere), though sadly few people seem to be using it in relation to the beer...

Name: Averbode
Description: A Belgian, bottled-conditioned blonde beer, brewed by Huyghe Brewery (famous for their Delirium Tremens) in collaboration with the Averode Abbey, a Premonstratensian abbey near Diest.

Name: Brugse Zot
Description: Ah, Brugse Zot, the town beer of Bruges from the Brouwerij De Halve Maan (meaning 'half moon') made with four different malts and two varieties of hop.

Name: Belgoo Magus
Description: A golden four grain Belgian beer made with wheat, barley, spelt and oats!

Name: Moinette Blonde
Description: Created in 1955 and originally sold under the \"Abbaye de la Moinette” name, it's been simply Moinette since 1980.

Name: La Chouffe
Description: A blonde/blond beer from the Ardennes. Unfiltered and bottle conditioned, it's made with both hops and coriander.

Name: Troubadour Blonde
Description: A classic Belgian style Blonde from the Troubadour range, excellent for warm evenings on sunny holidays.

Name: Brugse Zot Dubbel
Description: A Belgian dubbel from a brewery in the heart of historic Bruges with roots back to the 16th century that was reborn in 2005 by the descendants of the Maes family, who had owned it since 1856.

Name: Delirium Nocturnum
Description: Delirium Tremens' brother, Delirium Nocturnum, is a darker style of Belgian ale from the Huyghe Brewery, featuring more robust notes of well-roasted malt at its core.

Name: Paulaner Salvator
Description: The strongest beer from Paulaner Brauerei - Salvator! A big-bodied, bottom-fermented German doppelbock, brewed by Paulaner for over 350 years.

Name: Siren Broken Dream
Description: This right here is Siren Craft Brew's breakfast stout, Broken Dream. A dramatic name for a big-bodied, coffee rich brew.

Name: Straffe Hendrik Quadrupel
Description: A rich dark quadrupel from Huisbrouwerij De Halve Maan, situated in the heart of beautiful Bruges. (\"It's in Belgium.

Name: Bush Ambrée
Description: A tripel made with caramel malt and their own house yeast that's been cultivated for over 80 years. It was first brewed in 1933 by the grandfather of current master brewer Hugues Dubuisson.

Name: Gulden Draak
Description: Golden Draak from the Van Steenberge brewery is a rather strong Belgian dark ale named after the statue at the top of the Belfry of Ghent - a golden dragon!

Name: Kasteelbier Donker
Description: From Brewery Van Honsebrouck (founded by Amandus Van Honsebrouck back in the 1800s, though it was only given that name in the mid-1900s by Luc Van Honsebrouck) comes their Donker Qaudrupel style

Name: Troubadour Westkust
Description: A dark, heavily hopped Belgian ale from The Musketeers brewery, founded in 2000.

Name: Delirium Red
Description: A cherry-flavoured entry in the memory of Delirium beers (yes, we used the collective noun for elephants to group all the Delirium beers together, and we feel very clever for doing so).

Name: Floris Chocolate
Description: From the Floris range, produced by Huyghe Brewery, based around a wheat beer recipe and combined with chocolate. Very sweet and chocolatey (as you might expect).

Name: Floris Framboise
Description: Ah, one of those Floris fruit beers from the Huyghe Brewery, produced in Belgium! This would pair excellently with a bowl of vanilla ice cream we reckon...

Name: Floris Kriek
Description: An interesting fruit beer from the Floris range, produced by the Huyghe Brewery in Belgium, made using a wheat beer recipe and featuring the juicy notes of cherries.

Name: Floris Honey
Description: Something a little different from the Belgian Floris range - a honey flavoured beer!

Name: Floris Mango
Description: A juicy, exotic flavour of Floris which incorporates fresh mango juice, produced in Belgium by the Huyghe Brewery (well know for producing the Delirium Tremens and more).

Name: Floris Ninkeberry
Description: A gamut of juicy fruits go into making the Floris Ninkeberry, which is based around a wheat beer recipe. Look out for notes of passion fruit, apricot, mango and peach...

Name: Floris Passion
Description: One of those famous Floris fruit beers from the Belgian Huyghe Brewery.

Name: Früli Strawberry Beer
Description: Strawberries and wheat beer - not a flavour combination that comes to mind all that often, unless you're a regular sipper of the delicious Früli Strawberry Beer, produced in Belgium.

Name: Lindemans Apple (37.5cl)
Description: An apple flavoured Lambic beer from the world famous Lindemans range. These brewers make some absolutely fantastic Lambics, and have a wonderful selection of fruit-based variants to tempt you with...

Name: Lindemans Cassis (37.5cl)
Description: Perfect for accompanying sweet desserts or for enjoying on a warm afternoon, Lindemans Cassis is a richly fruity Lambic beer from Belgium.

Name: Lindemans Framboise (37.5cl)
Description: From the top range of fruit-flavoured Lambic beers produced by Lindemans comes their rather lovely raspberry edition, fit to burst with juicy, vibrant raspberry sweetness.

Name: Lindemans Kriek (37.5cl)
Description: The classic Lindemans fruit-focussed Lambic beer - Lindemans Kriek. A superbly flavoursome beer, with in-your-face cherry notes aplenty.

Name: Lindemans Pecheresse (37.5cl)
Description: For their Pecheresse Lambic beer, the Lindemans brewers in Belgium add a portion of peach juice to give the beer its sweet, juicy, expressive personality.

Name: Mongozo Banana
Description: From the Dutch Mongozo range of vibrantly flavoured beers comes a banana flavoured edition.

Name: Mongozo Coconut
Description: A very intriguing coconut beer from the Mongozo range, which is based in The Netherlands. Combining notes of coconut and quinoa, this makes for a rather unique tipple. Serve well chilled.

Name: Mongozo Mango
Description: Need something cool, refreshing and sweet on a hot summer evening? Try one of the exotic flavoured beers from the Mongozo range, produced in The Netherlands.

Name: Barbãr
Description: A blonde honey ale from Brasserie Lefebvre (who also produce Blanche de Bruxelles) based on ancient cervoise beer, known as 'Warrior’s rest'.

Name: Boon Framboise (37.5cl)
Description: Boon Frambois is made by adding fresh raspberries (25%) and cherries to Lambic beer, fermented by wild yeast, which starts a second fermentation.

Name: Boon Kriek (37.5cl)
Description: Belgian Lambic made with cherries! No artificial colouring or flavouring is used, just fresh black cherries (25%) added to old and young lambic to provoke a second wild fermentation.

Name: Pêche Mel Bush
Description: Made with Bush Ambrée and peach lambic, this strong fruity beer is based on a popular Belgian student drink! Serve well-chilled.

Name: Hiver Honey Beer
Description: Hiver Honey Beer is a delicious blonde made using honey from British bee-keepers, which  is added at the fermentation stage.

Name: Kasteelbier Rouge
Description: Kasteel Rouge is a rather interesting concoction from Van Honsebrouck, which combined their Donker Quadrupel style beer with cherry liqueur!

Name: Hacker-Pschorr Münchner Kellerbier Anno 1417
Description: Hacker-Pschorr's Münchner Kellerbier Anno 1417 harks back to the old days of Bavarian brewing, and as such, this flavoursome lager is bottled without filtration.

Name: Hacker-Pschorr Munich Gold
Description: A fine example of German lager from Hacker-Pschorr. Munich Gold is full-bodied and packed with creamy, malty goodness, making it a fine choice for enjoying on a long, warm evening...

Name: Hacker-Pschorr Münchner Hell
Description: Top quality lager from the Hacker-Pschorr brewery in munich, one of the six breweries which provide the beer for the city's annual Oktoberfest celebrations.

Name: Fourpure Pils
Description: The Fourpure Brewing Co. in London have made their own imagining of the classic German Pilsner, featuring a combination of Hallertau Mittelfrüh and Saaz hops. Delicious enjoyed cold.

Name: Kona Longboard Island Lager (35.5cl)
Description: A rather delightful lager from the Hawaii-based Kona Brewing Co., whose labels always seem to be awesome.

Name: Paulaner Münchner Hell
Description: This is a classic Munich lager from Paulaner Brauerei, who have been brewing in the German city since the 1600s.

Name: Paulaner Münchner Dunkel
Description: A traditional style of lager from Paulaner Brauerei, made with a higher percentage of roasted malts then their classic Münchner Hell.

Name: Augustiner-Bräu Edelstoff
Description: An export strength beer from Augustiner, the oldest brewery in Munich, first brewed in 1927.

Name: Augustiner-Bräu Lagerbier Hell
Description: A classic Helles lager from the oldest brewery in Munich.

Name: Slag Lager Bier
Description: Well then, it's Slag Lager Bier. A Belgian Pils from Brouwerij Slaghmuylder, who brew the Witkap-Pater beers.

Name: Mongozo Premium Pilsner
Description: The Mongozo Premium Pilsner is a Fairtrade, gluten-free, organic Dutch beer made using barley malt, rice and hops. Interesting stuff...

Name: Omission Lager (35.5cl)
Description: An American lager, produced in Portland Oregon by Widmer Brothers Brewing, featuring Mt. Hood, Sterling and Hallertau hops.

Name: Omission Pale Ale
Description: A pale ale from the Omission range, produced by Widmer Brothers Brewing in Portland, Oregon, with cascade hops at its core.

Name: Fourpure IPA
Description: Founded in 2013, Fourpour Brewing Co. in London already have a rather excellent selection of craft beers, like their ace IPA.

Name: Fourpure Pale Ale
Description: A West Coast-inspired hoppy session ale from Fourpure with malt that doesn't just make up the numbers.

Name: Fourpure Session IPA
Description: Taking plenty of inspiration from American IPA, Fourpure's Session IPA is a well-hopped beauty, featuring Ahtanum, Citra, Crystal, Galaxy and Mosaic hops.

Name: Kona Castaway IPA (35.5cl)
Description: Wilson! Wilson, this is an IPA called Castaway from the Kona Brewing Co., made with Galaxy, Simcoe, Citra and Millennium hops! Wilson!!!

Name: Kona Fire Rock Pale Ale
Description: A light, fruity pale ale from the Kona Brewing Company, which is based in Hawaii. They refer to it as a 'Hawaiian-Style' pale ale, and the label certainly fits the bill, doesn't it?

Name: Redhook Long Hammer IPA (35.5cl)
Description: A big, pine-y American IPA from Redhook, who started brewing over 30 years ago in Seattle, WA. This is dry-hopped and features the wonderful freshness of the cascade hop at its core.

Name: Siren Soundwave IPA
Description: From Siren Craft Brewing in Berkshire comes the Soundwave IPA, a West Coast styled treat that is just bursting at the seams with vibrant fruit notes.

Name: Siren Undercurrent
Description: Undercurrent from Siren Craft Brew in Berkshire is a rather interesting pale ale made with oats as one of its grains, along with cascade and palisade hops. Excellent bottles, too.

Name: Troubadour Magma
Description: The Troubadour Magma (fantastic name, by the way) sees a classic combination of flavours - you've got the big, bold, fruity notes from some of Belgium's tastiest ales working alongside the classic

Name: Vedett Extra Ordinary IPA
Description: Brewed at Duvel, this is a modern Belgian IPA that's dry hopped with four American hop varieties and features a walrus as a mascot! There is nothing not to like here.

Name: Fourpure Oatmeal Stout
Description: A creamy, luxurious Outmeal Stout from London-based brewery, Fourpure Brewing Company. Big and bold, but delightfully drinkable indeed - grab a can, grab a glass and enjoy.

Name: Hercule Stout
Description: A Belgian Stout which has been named after one of our favourite detectives, Hercule Poirot, owner of one of our favourite moustaches!

Name: Troubadour Obscura
Description: A rather interesting beer from the Belgian Troubadour selection - the Obscura features many of a stout's classic characteristics (think roasted malt giving off chocolate and coffee notes aplenty),

Name: Troubadour Imperial Stout
Description: From the Troubadour range, brewed in Belgium, comes a richly nutty Imperial Stout!

Name: Siren Liquid Mistress
Description: A well-hopped red IPA from Siren Craft Brew in Berkshire. Malty and sweet with a good burst of hops later on.

Name: Duchesse de Bourgogne
Description: Duchesse de Bourgogne is Flemish red sour beer that takes from the country's beers being known as the 'Burgundies of Belgium'. It's a blend of 8 and 18 month old beer.

Name: Rodenbach Grand Cru
Description: A classic Flemish red sour beer with a higher proportion of older beer (2/3) in than blend than the Rodenbach original, and a higher abv.

Name: Saison 1900
Description: First released in 1982, this is a refreshing saison from Brasserie Lefebvre near Brussels.

Name: Saison Dupont
Description: A saison thought to date back to 1844 on the Rimaux-Deridder farm brewery, which Alfred Dupont would go on to purchase for his son in 1920. Top traditional Belgian farmhouse refreshment.

Name: Lindemans Faro (37.5cl)
Description: A Lambic beer from the Lindemans folks, harking back to an old tradition of adding sugar to Lambic beer to make it more approachable.

Name: Lindemans Oude Gueuze Cuvée René (37.5cl)
Description: Lindemans Oude Gueuze Cuvée René is a blend of young and old Lambic beer, which is matured in large oak barrels and then bottle conditioned. Much like a wine, this will cellar very well...

Name: Siren Calypso
Description: In an homage to the Goddess Calypso, who was known for her sharp tongue, Siren Craft Brew created this dry-hopped Berliner-style sour beer!

Name: Boon Oude Geuze 2012 Mariage Parfait (37.5cl)
Description: Traditional geuze lambic, made by blending younger lambic beer (perhaps a year old) with older lambic before a further fermentation in the bottle.

Name: Oud Beersel Framboise (37.5cl)
Description: From the Belgian Oud Beersel brewery comes their Framboise beer, made by combining their excellent Lambic beer with oodles of raspberries (and handful of cherries too).

Name: Oud Beersel Oude Kriek Vieille (37.5cl)
Description: An excellent Kriek from the Oud Beersel Brewery in Belgian (not far from the centre of Brussels).

Name: Delirium Tremens
Description: The most famous beer from the Belgian Huyghe Brewery, Delirium Tremens is notable for being made with three types of yeast - it's also well known for its bottle reminiscent of Cologne ceramics.

Name: La Guillotine
Description: La Guillotine comes to us via the Belgian Huyghe Brewery, well known for their Delirium beers.

Name: Kona Big Wave Golden Ale (35.5cl)
Description: The tasty Big Wave Golden Ale from the Hawaii-based Kona Brewing Co., made to be an easy-drinking treat after a hard day surfing. If you were to say hello to this beer, you might give it a...

Name: Straffe Hendrik Tripel
Description: An awesome golden abbey style tripel from the heart of historic Bruges. Been there we have, tasted it at the brewery, bloody delicious it is too!

Name: DeuS Brut des Flandres Cuvée Prestige 2014
Description: A beer made somewhat like a fine sparkling wine, the beer is brewed at Bosteels in Belgium before being sent to Champagne.

Name: Duvel
Description: Duvel is perhaps the definitive golden Belgian blonde ale.

Name: Gouden Carolus Classic
Description: Named World's Best Dark Ale at the World Beer Awards in 2012, Gouden Carolus is brewed at Het Anker in Mechelen. Perfect for cellaring for as long as you want.

Name: Grotten Santé
Description: A cave-aged Belgian brown ale from Brouwerij De Kazematten, which is based in the town of Ypres in West Flanders.

Name: Kasteelbier Tripel
Description: This is Brewery Van Honsebrouck's Tripel style strong Belgian ale, weighing in at a generous 11% ABV. Very attractive golden hue to this one, with plenty of hops used to give it a rich bitterness.

Name: Satan Gold
Description: The devil comes in many forms, forms like Red, and Gold. This is the gold one. A strong Belgian pale ale waiting for you to welcome it into your home.

Name: Tripel Karmeliet
Description: An abbey style tripel first released in 1996, based on a 17th century recipe that calls for wheat, oats and barley.

Name: Hacker-Pschorr Weisse
Description: A traditional wheat beer from Hacker-Pschorr, one of the six breweries that supply beer for Munich's Oktoberfest celebrations. A simple but stunning beer from the German brewers.

Name: Hopf Helle Weisse
Description: A rather tasty German wheat beer, rather classic in style. You'll be getting a lot of fruit and spice from this one. Serve cold on a warm afternoon...

Name: Mongozo Buckwheat White
Description: From the Mongozo range, produced in The Netherlands, comes a quite interesting gluten free wheat beer - you see, the Mongozo Buckwheat White is made using buckwheat alongside hops and rice, and is

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb
Description: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb is one of Germany's most popular wheat beers. The brewery was established back in the 1600s and resides in the beautiful city of Munich.

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb Can
Description: One of Germany's favourite Hefe-Weißbier, now available in a can!

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Dunkel
Description: For their Hefe-Weißbier Dunkel, Paulaner Brauerei used a high percentage of dark Munich malts, resulting in a deep bronze hue.

Name: Blanche de Bruxelles
Description: A Belgian wheat beer from the village of Quenast, not far from Brussels.

Name: St. Bernardus Abt 12
Description: A rather inviting Quadrupel style ale from the Belgian St. Bernardus brewery. A rather inviting Quad, with plenty of hop bitterness and balancing sweetness.

Name: St. Bernardus Pater 6
Description: An abbey style dubbel from the Sint Bernardus brewery, which takes its name from Mont des Cats monks who were forced to cross the border between France and Belgium at the start of the 20th century and

Name: St. Bernardus Tripel
Description: The St. Bernardus Tripel is a rich though light ale from the Belgian brewery, featuring juicy notes of citrus running through its core.

Name: St. Bernardus Wit
Description: A charming wheat beer from the Belgian St. Bernardus brewery, which was developed in collaboration with Master Brewer Pierre Celis.

Name: St-Feuillien Blonde
Description: A strong blonde ale from the fourth generation brewers at St-Feuillien, a brewery named after a 7th century Irish monk who was martyred at Le Roeulx.

Name: St-Feuillien Brune Réserve
Description: An traditional bottle conditioned abbey-style dubbel from top Belgian brewers St-Feuillien.

Name: St-Feuillien Triple
Description: An abbey-style 8.5% beer from the excellent St-Feuillien.

Name: Witkap-Pater Stimulo
Description: A bottle conditioned golden 'singel' from Brouwerij Slaghmuylder in Belgium.

Name: Achel 8 Blond
Description: Achel or Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis, is (as you may have guessed from the full name) a true Trappist brewery.

Name: Chimay Bleue
Description: A true Trappist beer, Chimay abbey is recognised by the International Trappist Association of which it was a founding member. Chimay blue is bottle conditioned and weighs in at a strong 9% abv.

Name: Chimay Rouge
Description: The original Chimay Trappist beer, still made within the walls of the abbey under the supervision of the monks (and hence able to carry the logo of the International Trappist Association). A classic.

Name: Chimay Triple
Description: An authentic golden Trappist tripel from Chimay, brewed within the wall of the Abbaye Notre-Dame de Scourmont.

Name: La Trappe Blond
Description: An excellent Trappist Blond ale from the Dutch La Trappe selection.

Name: La Trappe Dubbel
Description: Classic Trappist Dubbel from Koningshoeven Abbey in the Netherlands, a founding member of the International Trappist Association.

Name: La Trappe Puur
Description: This Trappist pale ale from the Dutch La Trappe range has been made using organic malted barley and organic hops, and it's been brewed using green energy too!

Name: La Trappe Quadrupel
Description: A quadrupel that started it all from the innovative Dutch Trappist Koningshoeven brewery! Fill your boots.

Name: La Trappe Tripel
Description: This is the Tripel from La Trappe's ace range of Trappist ales. Something of a classic, this.

Name: Orval
Description: An all-time great of a beer, this classic Belgian Trappist ale is made under the supervision of the monks at l'Abbaye d'Orval.

Name: Trappistes Rochefort 10
Description: Rochefort's leading beer, one of the most highly rated Trappist beers (or beers of any style) in the world.

Name: Trappistes Rochefort 6
Description: The Trappist abbey of Rochefort (or the Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy) is one of just six true Trappist brewers within Belgium.

Name: Trappistes Rochefort 8
Description: A newer release from authentic Trappist brewers at Rochefort Abbey (also known as the Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy).

Name: Westmalle Dubbel
Description: The Dubbel from Belgian Trappist brewery Westmalle is a definitive Dubbel. With its classic deep ruby hue and expressive palate, this is top quality Belgian ale here.

Name: Westmalle Tripel
Description: The mother of all tripels, first brewed in 1934, this highly regarded authentic Trappist beer has inspired many imitators over the years and is still oneof the finest examples available.

Name: Belgoo Bio Blond Organic
Description: An organic Belgian beer malt with three grains: wheat, barley and spelt. Formerly known as Bioloo Blond, it's brewed by Jo Van Aerts.

Name: Mikkeller 2012 Fra Til Via Cognac Barrel Aged (37.5cl)
Description: An excellent Christmas gift for the beer enthusiast in your life - this edition of Mikeller's 2012 Fra Til Via Imperial Porter has been aged in Cognac barrels!

Name: High Weald Greenstede Golden Ale
Description: High Weald's Greenstede Golden Ale sees the East Grinstead brewers combining British and American hop varieties in one refreshing brew which is just perfect for summer evenings.

Name: High Weald Chronicle Sussex Bitter
Description: A rather tasty bitter from the folks at High Weald Brewery in East Grinstead. They've gone and used a combination of Fuggles and Goldings hops for this one.

Name: BrewDog Jet Black Heart
Description: Jet Black Heart won the hearts of beer fans in BrewDog's 2015 Prototype Series, and with good reason - it's a bloomin' excellent milk stout brewed with Magnum and Sorachi Ace hops and loaded with

Name: BrewDog Dead Pony Club
Description: A hop-heavy pale ale from Scottish craft brewers, BrewDog, inspired by the west-coast of America.

Name: BrewDog Nanny State
Description: Nanny State is BrewDog's answer to the world of low-alcohol beers. Weighing in at 0.

Name: BrewDog Arcade Nation
Description: A marvellously toasted black IPA from BrewDog, launched in 2016.

Name: BrewDog Prototype Black IPA
Description: This Black IPA from BrewDog was released as part of the 2015 Prototype Series, and though the name might sound a little bit like an oxymoron, the beer itself is spot-on.

Name: Brewdog Prototype Hopped-Up Brown Ale
Description: Part of BrewDog's 2015 Prototype series, the Hopped-Up Brown Ale sees the Scottish craft brewers tackle a delicious brown ale with plenty of hops at the ready.

Name: Brewdog Jack Hammer Gift Pack
Description: A great present for the bitterest person in your life - 2 bottles of BrewDog's Jack Hammer IPA and a BrewDog-branded glass. Jam-packed with hops, this one. Aces.

Name: Brewdog Black Eyed King Imp
Description: BrewDog's Black Eyed King Imp was the world's strongest canned ale, weighing in at a hefty 12.7% ABV.

Name: Mikkeller Vild
Description: A strong Belgian ale produced at D'Proef for Mikkeller's fantastic range of craft beers. Bottled at 12.3% ABV, this is a particularly hefty brew, though its personality manages to stay rather light.

Name: Brew By Numbers 03|05 Porter (Willamette & Centennial)
Description: From the wonderful Brew By Numbers range (which features a handy naming convention, where the first number refers to the beer's style and the second number refers to the beer's recipe) comes 03|05, an

Name: Stillwater As Follows
Description: As Follows is a hoppy Belgian style golden ale from Stillwater, an American brewing company Brian Strumke. They say this is \"...built sturdy enough to withstand the Apocalypse...

Name: Stillwater Cellar Door
Description: An American wheat beer from the Stillwater selection - this has been brewed using German wheat and pale malts, alongside Citra and Sterling hops as well as a subtle touch of white sage.

Name: Stillwater Debutante Biere De Garde
Description: A collaboration between two Baltimore-based beer wonders - Stillwater and The Brewer's Art, who helped to pioneer Belgian beer's surge in popularity in the USA.

Name: Stillwater Artisanal Of Love & Regret Flower Saison
Description: A florally-focussed Saison, made in Belgium as a collaboration between Stillwater (from Baltimore) and brewmaster Jef Goetelen (from Antwerp).

Name: Stillwater Stateside Saison Farmhouse Ale
Description: A tasty Saison from the Stillwater folks in the USA, made with a combination of American and New Zealand hops, and it's also been bottle-conditioned.

Name: Stillwater Vacuum
Description: Stillwater's Readymade: Vacuum is a combination of a few styles - it's a smoked black IPA!

Name: Summer Wine Diablo IPA
Description: This handsome devil is Summer Wine Brewery's Diablo IPA, made with plenty of Citra and Chinook hops. Big ol' whacks of punch-y, pine-y goodness and juicy tropical fruit all the way throughout.

Name: Summer Wine Mokko Milk Stout
Description: Mokko is Summer Wine Brewery's delicious Milk Stout, made with oodles of dark malts, lactose and a deft touch of East Kent Goldings hops.

Name: Summer Wine Pacer Session IPA
Description: A fantastic Session IPA from Yorkshire-based brewers, Summer Wine. They've gone and used a combination of American Chinook and Centennial hops along with English Pale and Caramel malts for this one.

Name: Summer Wine Sucker Punch
Description: Summer Wine Brewery's Sucker Punch Pale Ale is chock-full of big ol' hoppy goodness.

Name: Summer Wine Golden Gate
Description: With a name like Golden Gate, you might expect this delicious \"Double-India Lager\" to hail from the sunny west coast of America. Well, it doesn't.

Name: Stillwater Artisanal Classique Can
Description: The Stillwater brewers in the USA call their Classique Saison a Postmodern beer - \"a deconstruction of American industrial lager\".

Name: Stillwater Yacht (47.3cl)
Description: Stillwater's Yacht is situated somewhere between the olden days where the only beers that came in cans were your everyday lagers and the boom of craft brewers putting everything they've got into these

Name: Brew By Numbers 02|16 Golden Ale Saphir & Amarillo
Description: A deliciously refreshing golden ale from the folks at Brew By Numbers in London. 02|16 is  made using a combination of Amarillo and Saphir hops, resulting in juicy notes of citrus and stone fruit.

Name: Brew By Numbers 08|06 Stout (Oatmeal)
Description: A yummy, creamy, somewhat luxurious oatmeal stout from the Brew By Numbers selection.

Name: Brew By Numbers 09|05 Brown Ale Chinook & Centennial
Description: A delicious ale made with both Chinook and Centennial hops (both very popular in USA-style beers) by the Brew By Numbers crew in Bermondsey.

Name: Brew By Numbers 11|03 Session IPA (Mosaic)
Description: Brew By Numbers 11|03 is a rather glorious session IPA made with Mosaic hops - big ol' hoppy deliciousness here from those citrus-note-rich Mosaic rascals.

Name: Burning Sky Arise IPA
Description: A session IPA from Burning Sky Beer in East Sussex - not a huge hoppy kick to this one, though you're still getting plenty of delicious waves of resinous pine and fresh fruit.

Name: Burning Sky Easy Answers IPA
Description: Fancy a tasty IPA from the Burning Sky Beer selection? We've got an Easy Answer for that question right here!

Name: Buxton Brewery Patersbier
Description: Patersbier (or Father's Beer, if you will), is a Belgian-inspired brew from the Buxton Brewery. A rather traditionally styled beer filled with Belgian yeast characteristics.

Name: Harviestoun Old Engine Oil Engineer's Reserve
Description: A higher-strength edition of Harviestoun's excellent Old Engine Oil, a gloriously dark Scottish ale made with Galena, East Kent Goldings and Fuggles hops.

Name: Harviestoun Old Engine Oil
Description: A classic from the Harviestoun brewery range - Old Engine Old!

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Chinook Amarillo
Description: The Kernel Brewery in London have produced stacks and stacks of delicious and Pale Ales and IPAs using a multitude of hop combinations.

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Cascade Chinook
Description: Another yummy Pale Ale from The Kernal brewery in London, this time making using of Cascade and Chinook hops. Prepare for some delicious hoppy-tropical-fruit notes here...

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Cascade Mosaic Nelson Sauvin
Description: Another top quality Pale Ale from the London brewers Kernel. This time, they've used a trio of well-loved hops - Cascade, Mosaic and Nelson Sauvin.

Name: The Kernel IPA Amarillo Mosaic
Description: A stupendous IPA from the Kernal Brewery in London, made with a combination of Amarillo and Mosaic hops. Perfect for enjoying on a sunny afternoon...

Name: Magic Rock Cannonball
Description: \"I need all of you to stop what you're doing and listen. Cannonball!!!\"\r\n\r\nA wonderfully hop-forward IPA from the Magic Rock Brewery in Huddersfield, Cannonball is a big ol' blast of deliciousness.

Name: Magic Rock High Wire Grapefruit
Description: A grapefruit variation on Huddersfield-based brewery Magic Rock's High Wire Pale Ale, inspired by America's West Coast. Loads of fruity hops with grounding notes of refreshing malts...

Name: Magic Rock Salty Kiss
Description: Ooh, now this is interesting - it's a Gose beer from Magic Rock Brewing in Huddersfield!

Name: Moor Beer Company Amoor
Description: A rather splendid Porter from south-west-based brewery Moor! If you're a fan of rich, indulgent beers packed with chocolate notes and earthy elements, you might just \"amore\" the Moor Amoor...

Name: Moor Beer Company Smokey Horyzon
Description: A tasty, smokey, rye-y beer from Moor Beer Co. in the south west! A well balanced brew, with a subtle hint of peppery rye spice helping along the fragrant smoke...

Name: Pressure Drop Pale Fire
Description: Pressure Drop's Pale Fire is a marvellous pale ale packed full of hop goodness.

Name: Pressure Drop Stokey Brown
Description: This is Pressure Drop's Stokey Brown, a delicious dark ale that shows off lots of yummy malty notes along with a generous whack of hop bitterness along the way.

Name: Redchurch Great Eastern IPA
Description: The Redchurch Brewery use a combination of Centennial, Columbus and Chinook hops to craft their Splendid Great Eastern IPA. Redchurch are currently brewing their excellent beers in Bethnal Green.

Name: Redchurch Hoxton Stout
Description: A well-balanced Stout from Bethnal Green-based brewers, Redchurch.

Name: Weird Beard Black Perle
Description: Black Perle is Weird Beard's Milk Coffee Stout, brewed with lactose and whole bean Hasbean coffee.

Name: Weird Beard Decadence Stout
Description: As you could probably guess from the name and the skull wearing a top hat and monocle on the label, Weird Beard's Decadence Stout is a rich, roast-y, chocolate-y, all-around-yummy treat for your taste

Name: Weird Beard Faithless Spreadsheet Ninja
Description: A black pilsner inspired by the beers of Japan from Weird Beard brewers in West London, made with carafa malt and a hint of roasted barley, alongside Summit, Hersbrucker and Sorachi Ace hops.

Name: Weird Beard K*ntish Town Beard 50cl
Description: An American-style wheat ale from the wonderful Weird Beard Brew Co., made somewhat like a Pale Ale with a good portion of wheat at its core with an American ale yeast.

Name: Weird Beard Little Things That Kill
Description: A sessionable IPA from Ealing's Weird Beard Brewing! The label described it as a \"violently hoppy little beer\

Name: Weird Beard Saison 14
Description: A superbly refreshing Saison from the Weird Beard Brew Co. in West London, which has been made with Pacific Gem hops and dry-hopped with Sorachi Ace hops.

Name: Weird Beard Traditional Spreadsheet Ninja
Description: When faced with a shortage of Citra hops, Weird Bread Brew Co. decided to make some variations of their Spreadsheet Ninja pilsner!

Name: Westerham Hop Rocket IPA
Description: 5... 4... 3... 2... 1... Lift off, we have lift of the Westerham Hop Rocket IPA!

Name: Redchurch Sauvage Blanc
Description: From the Redchurch Brewery's Wild Series comes their Sauvage Blanc Saison, made using coriander seed, crushed white grape and foraged bay leaves in the brew.

Name: Redchurch Tartelette
Description: A refreshing, zesty sour beer from the Redchurch Brewery in Bethnal Green - this has been brewed with an initial lactobacillus souring followed by a saccharomyces fermentation.

Name: Redchurch Urban Farmhouse
Description: A rather classically styled Saison with a touch of sour yeast at its core - great as a refreshing treat on warm afternoons.

Name: Wiper and True In The Pines Amber Ale
Description: An Amber Ale with a rather evocative name from Wiper & True, a Bristol-based brewery.

Name: Wiper and True Hard Shake Milk Stout
Description: A big-bodied Milk Stout from Wiper & True, a Bristol-based brewery with oodles of style and talent.

Name: Wiper and True White Cloud IPA
Description: For their White Cloud IPA, Wiper & True use a combination of bright, zesty New Zealand hops to give this brew delicious notes of fresh, tangy fruit.

Name: Wiper and True Amber Ale Amarillo
Description: From Bristol-based brewery Wiper & True comes the first single hop pale ale, focussing on the awesome Amarillo hop! Dee-lish!

Name: Wiper and True Australia Pale Ale
Description: Only Australian hops are used to make Wiper & True's Australia Pale Ale. Go into this one expecting big ol' bushels of fresh fruit notes and you won't be disappointed.

Name: Wiper and True Small Beer No.14
Description: The Wiper & True brewers from Bristol do like to put together a tasty small beer - they've got quite a series going! This is their Small beer No.

Name: Wiper and True Triptych No.11
Description: This is the 11th instalment of Wiper & True's Truptych series - a fruity Pale Ale made with Citra, Amarillo and Mosaic hops.

Name: Wiper and True Abbey Rye Winter Ale
Description: Wiper & True's Abbey Rye Winter Ale is packed with sweet spice and caramelised fruit notes - this'll mostly certainly make for a warming treat during the chilly winter months.

Name: Brussels Beer Project Babylone
Description: Babylone comes to us via the Belgian Beer Project, with part of its recipe coming from recycled bread! Fresh bread from supermarkets makes up a big portion of food waste, which is a massive shame.

Name: Brussels Beer Project Dark Sister
Description: A Belgian IPA made with roasted and toasted malt by the Brussels Beer Project. This was conceived as an \"evil twin\" to their Delta IPA...

Name: Brussels Beer Project Grosse Bertha
Description: A Bavarian-style Hefeweizen from the Brussels Beer Project, who like to try different things rather than to keep going over the same styles of beers that have been produced in Belgium for hundreds of

Name: Brussels Beer Project Tante Tatin
