Description: A Belgian Quadruple beer from the Brussels Beer Project - but of course, that's not all that's going on with this one! They've brewed this using some scrummy Jonagold apples in the mix, resulting in..

Name: Dochter Van De Korenaar Extase
Brewery: Brouwerij De Dochter van de Korenaar
Bottler: Brouwerij De Dochter van de Korenaar
Description: A big, bold IPA from Belgian brewers, Brouwerij De Dochter Van De Korenaar. They are located in the Belgian side of Baarle, which shared some very complicated borders with the Dutch side of Baarle.

Name: Liefmans Goudenband
Description: A fantastic Lambic here from the Liefmans range which is allowed to rest after brewing in open vats for four to twelve months and then blended with some younger beer to finish it off.

Name: Petrus Aged Red
Description: An aged sour cherry beer from the Belgian Petrus range, made by combining a small portion of their Aged Pale (which spends up to 2 years maturing) and plenty of their Dubbel Brun along with cherries.

Name: Petrus Oud Bruin
Description: A Belgian brown sour beer from the Petrus range, made with a combination of their aged Pale (which spends up to 2 years maturing) and young brown beer.

Name: St-Feuillien Cuvée De Noël (33cl)
Description: St-Feuillien Cuvée de Noël is about as Christmas-y as watching Santa drop Chocolate Oranges down your chimney while Rudolf and his pals play charades on your roof.

Name: To Øl Black Maria IPA
Description: A somewhat American-style Black IPA from To Øl, who are based in Denmark but brew at a number of different breweries. This has been made with a focus on Carafa malts and plenty of delicious hops.

Name: To Øl Cloud 9 Wit
Description: A superb wheat beer from the To Øl chaps, made with a combination of Curaçao orange peel and mango, as well as some rather up-front hops.

Name: To Øl First Frontier
Description: A big ol' American-style IPA here from the To Øl brewers - it's all about the hops!

Name: To Øl Friends With Benefits
Description: To Øl brewed their Friends With Benefits APA for their friends at Mikkeller and Friends bar (owned by the excellent Mikkeler).

Name: To Øl Garden Of Eden
Description: A massively fruit-forward IPA from Danish brewers To Øl, which has been brewed with apricot, guava, papaya, passion fruit and mango, as well as Mosaic hops. Fruit salad, anyone?

Name: To Øl Hundelufter Bajer
Description: A tropical-fruit forward Seassion IPA from To Øl, made for their friends at the Barking Dog in Copenhagen.

Name: To Øl Smoke On The Porter Fire In The Rye
Description: We love puns and great beer, so we're having a field day over here with To Øl's Smoke on the Porter Fire in the Rye.

Name: To Øl Thirsty Frontier
Description: An excellent Session IPA from Danish nomad brewers, To Øl. Packed with Simcoe, Citra and Mosaic hops, this one. Get stuck in.

Name: To Øl Wit is the New Black
Description: Wit is the New Black is a Belgian-style wheat beer from To Øl, which interestingly has been brewed with liquorice, along with Ella and Vic Secret hops. Sweet and herbaceous.

Name: To Øl You Shall Nut Pass
Description: You Shall Nut Pass is a hazelnut Stout from the Danish brewers To Øl, made using helpings of chocolate rye and smoked malt alongside some other classic malts, as well as Summit and Hallertauer

Name: Hitachino Nest Pale Ale
Description: An excellent Pale Ale from the Hitchino Nest range, produced in Japan by the Kiuchi Brewery. Made with English malts (including the legendary Maris Otter) and a trio of fantastic hops.

Name: Hitachino Nest White Ale
Description: The Kiuchi brewers have aimed for a Belgian style of wheat beer with their wonderful Hitachino Nest White Ale - lots of spice and sweetness carried by the mellow, creamy mouth-feel.

Name: AleSmith Decadence 2015 Anniversary Ale
Description: From San Diago's AleSmith Brewing Company comes their Decadence 2015, part of a long series of their featuring many different styles of beer - this time, they've gone for a Belgian-style Amber Ale,

Name: AleSmith Double Red IPA
Description: AleSmith's Double Red IPA is just the ticket if you're looking for a winter treat - it's even the same colour as Santa's suit! Enjoy on a chilly evening and savour the rich, caramel-y malts.

Name: AleSmith Grand Cru
Description: A Belgian-style dark ale from AleSmith in San Diego, with a classically high ABV and oodles of spicy yeast and dark fruit notes. Ought to age rather well, this one...

Name: AleSmith Nut Brown
Description: An English-style Nut Brown Ale from the folks at AleSmith in San Diego, USA. Prepare for a rather indulgent brew packed with caramel, chocolate and nuts here...

Name: AleSmith Wee Heavy
Description: The AleSmith Brewing Co.

Name: AleSmith X
Description: AleSmith's X is an \"Extra\" Pale Ale - hence the name. Good balance of light, crisp malts and some classic (though restrained) Pale Ale hoppy bitterness. Great for summer drinking.

Name: Alpine Pure Hoppiness
Description: From the Alpine Beer Company in Alpine, California, comes their spectacular Pure Hoppiness Double IPA!

Name: Brooklyn Brewery Intensified Coffee Porter
Description: The Intensified Coffee Porter was created as part of Brooklyn Brewery's Brooklyn Quarterly Experiment series.

Name: Crooked Stave Hop Savant - Falconer's Flight
Description: A single hop varietal beer from Brettanomyces-focused brewery, Crooked Stave. As ever, they've created an intriguing Brett beer here, and they've only used one type of hop - Falconer's Flight.

Name: Crooked Stave St. Bretta Late Spring
Description: A Belgian style wheat beer from Crooked Stave, release as part of their St Bretta range - all of which are made with Brettanomyces and feature a different type of citrus.

Name: Crooked Stave St. Bretta Meyer Lemon
Description: Another release from Crooked Stave's St. Bretta series. (Get it? St. Bretta? Brettanomyces?

Name: Crooked Stave St. Bretta Pomelo
Description: The St. Bretta range from Crooked Stave is a series of Belgian-style wheat beer made with Brettanomyces as well as specific varieties of citrus dependent on what's in season at the time of brewing.

Name: Crooked Stave St. Bretta Valencia Orange
Description: Belgian style Brettanomyces wheat beer here from Crooked Stave's St. Bretta range.

Name: Evil Twin I Love You With My Stout
Description: An Evil Twin Imperial Stout brewed at Two Roads and presented in a 335ml bottle, along the same lines as their popular Even More Jesus.

Name: Evil Twin Low Life
Description: The tongue-in-cheek Low Life is said to be a golddigger of a beer where Evil Twin took  \"young, unacknowledged hoppy pilsner gave it a limp, wrinkly flavor and finished it off with an insulting high

Name: Evil Twin Molotov Cocktail
Description: Fire in the hole! A 13% explosion of hops in the form of an Evil Twin Imperial IPA in a 355ml bottle.

Name: Evil Twin Molotov Lite
Description: An Imperial IPA from Evil Twin Brewing. This 'lite' version is only 8.5%, but is still a hoppy \"tour de force\".

Name: Green Flash 30th Street Pale Ale
Description: When San Diego's Green Flash Brewing produce a dry hopped pale ale that's an \"homage to their local craft beer corridor\

Name: Green Flash Double Stout Black Ale
Description: An American double stout made with golden naked oats, dark crystal and roasted malt. This is a 355ml bottle.

Name: Green Flash Flanders Drive
Description: As the name suggests this is the Green Flash take on the classic Flanders red, aged in American oak bourbon barrels. It's very good - giving plenty of European sour ales a run for their money.

Name: Green Flash Oculus Sauvage IPA
Description: Oculus Sauvage is said to be a cross between a Belgian-style tripel and an American IPA. It's aged in red wine barrels, fermented with brettanomyces and dry hopped.

Name: Green Flash Pacific Gem
Description: A single hop beer from Green Flash, which uses the New Zealand hop Pacific Gem throughout the boil (it has high alpha acids) with malts chosen to allow the hops to shine through.

Name: Green Flash Soul Style IPA
Description: Green Flash love their doubles, triples and imperials, but here's their refreshing single IPA in an American 355ml bottle.

Name: Lost Abbey Angel's Share
Description: Strong ale in the barley wine tradition from American brewers Lost Abbey made with a high proportion of caramel malt and aged for at least 6 months in bourbon barrels.

Name: Lost Abbey Avante Garde
Description: Lost Abbey's take on Biere de Garde, whilst acknowledging that they're not worried about following styles religiously (excuse the pun).

Name: Lost Abbey Lost & Found
Description: An American abbey-style dubbel brewed with raisins

Name: The Lost Abbey 10 Commandments
Description: A Belgian-style farmhouse quad from Lost Abbey in the United States, which is a stronger version of their popular Lost and Found Abbey Ale.

Name: Lost Abbey Track #10
Description: A bourbon cask aged coffee and cacao nib version of Lost Abbey's Serpent’s Stout (also using Older Viscosity) released as part of their Ultimate Box Set.

Name: Port Brewing Santa's Little Helper (65cl)
Description: A seasonal imperial stout from Port Brewing, you may notice that Santa has been blacked out on some labels - that's because some people feel his jolly face and full festive attire shouldn't appear on

Name: Port Brewing Santa's Little Helper
Description: A seasonal beer that's actually released during the summer, after Port Brewing's regular Santa's Little Helper has been allowed to age in bourbon barrels. Presented in an American 375ml bottle.

Name: Stone 24 Carrot Golden Ale
Description: The winner of Stone Brewing's American Homebrewers Association competition 2015 was this carrot cake themed Belgian-style ale from Juli Goldenberg & Monkey Paw Pub & Brewery made with carrots,

Name: Wicked Weed Canvas Series Fille de Ferme
Description: From Wicked Weed's series of farmhouse ales fermented with their house brettanomyces comes Fille de Ferm, made with honeysuckle and orange peel.

Name: Wicked Weed Horti-Glory
Description: Another great farmhouse ale from Wicked Weed fermented with good ol' brettanomyces. Horty Glory is made with Riverbend malt, elderflower, hyssop and honeysuckle.

Name: Wicked Weed La Bonté with Figs
Description: A fruit saison from American brewers Wicked Weed, made with half a pound of figs per gallon.

Name: Wicked Weed La Bonté with Plum
Description: A farmhouse style ale with a name that translates as 'the goodness'. This version of Wicked Weed's La Bonte is made with plums.

Name: Wicked Weed Tropicmost Passionfruit Gose
Description: Wicked Weed's second Most Gose, made with wheat, salt and coriander. The 'tropic' element comes from passionfruit.

Name: Blue Marlin
Description: A 6% abv Mauritian lager first launched in 1990.

Name: Toast Ale
Description: A beer made from bread that would otherwise go to waste, whether that's the bread left over at the end of the day at artisanal bakers or the crusts leftover by sandwich makers!

Name: Brew By Numbers 17|02 Grisette Lemongrass
Description: A lower abv farmhouse ale from Brew by Numbers, this edition of their Grisette (17) is made with Lemongrass (2) as well as lemon zest and Wai-iti hops.

Name: Contreras Especial Mars
Description: A traditional seasonal beer made in spring, around March, the French for which is 'Mars'. Yo may also know this beer as Maarts or Maarts Tonneke.

Name: De Dolle Export Stout
Description: De Dolle brew stout twice a year, largely for the American market, but take their inspiration from traditional English and Irish examples.

Name: Diebels Alt
Description: A market leading Altbier produced in Issum, near Geldern, in Westphalia.

Name: Fourpure Beartooth
Description: A hopped brown/amber ale from London brewery Four Pure, founded by Dan & Tom Lowe in 2013. (With a bear on it.

Name: Gaffel Kölsch
Description: Perhaps the most famous Kölsch, a style of beer that can only be made in (or close to) Cologne, the city from which it takes its name (Köln in German).

Name: Gaverhopke Spring Tipple
Description: A blond Belgian tripel collabo' from 't Gaverhopke and White Pony Microbrewery.

Name: Hof Ten Dormaal Zure
Description: A sour beer from Hof Ten Dormaal made with ambient wild yeast. It spends a year in barrels and is cellared for months at the Engelburcht Monastery before release.

Name: Horal Megablend 2015
Description: A blend of young and old Lambic from 8 (!) members of Hoge raad voor ambachtelijke lambiekbieren (High council for artisanal lambik style beers), or HORAL.

Name: Liefmans Glühkriek
Description: A sour cherry beer made with the kinds of spices you'd find in glühwein/glögg/mulled wine! A festive treat to be enjoyed cold or warmed up.

Name: Lindemans Blossom Gueuze
Description: One of Lindemans' botanical lambic beers, in this case made with yummy elderflower.

Name: Lindemans 5 Year Old Cuvée René
Description: A special edition Gueuze from legends of the Lambic world, Lindemans, made using some well-aged beer blended with younger beer.

Name: Lindemans & Mikkeller Spontanbasil
Description: A fantastic collaboration between the much-admired Mikkeller and Lindemans, a legendary Belgian brewery famous for their Lambic beers.

Name: Meantime India Pale Ale
Description: An IPA from the Meantime Brewing Company in Greenwich, made using generous helpings of Kent Fuggles and Goldings hops.

Name: Moor Confidence
Description: A tasty bottle of Red Ale from the South West! Confidence from the Moor Beer Co. in Bristol is a well balanced Red Ale \"honouring those who inspire others\".

Name: Paulaner Oktoberfest
Description: A fantastic Oktoberfest beer here from Paulaner, brewed since 1818. Paulaner is one of the six breweries in Munich which makes beer for the city's annual Oktoberfest celebrations.

Name: Radeberger Pilsner
Description: Superb German Pilsner here from the town of Radeberg, dating back to the latter half of the 1800s. The brewers use water from their own well, which draws spring water from the nearby Karswald Forest.

Name: Siren & Cigar City Caribbean Chocolate Cake
Description: This delicious Stout is a collaborative brew between Siren Craft Brew in the UK and Cigar City Brewing in the USA.

Name: Siren & Stillwater Funkier Feet
Description: A collaborative brew by English company Siren Craft Brewing and Stillwater Artisinal in Baltimore, this 100% Brett barrel fermented wild ale, which has interestingly been blended with Le Grappin Rosé

Name: Siren Odyssey 005
Description: The fifth edition of Siren's Odyssey range - it's a Wee Heavy (or Scotch ale, if you like) which has been matured in both Banyuls and Armagnac barrels for 24 months before being blended together!

Name: Straffe Hendrik Wild
Description: A Belgian wild yeast beer from the Straffe Hendrik range, a variation on their top-notch Tripel. The brewers only bottle this tasty brew once a year!

Name: Vocation Divide & Conquer
Description: From the Vocation Brewery in West Yorkshire comes Divide & Conquer, a Black IPA where the roasted barley and tasty hops work together wonderfully.

Name: Vocation Life & Death
Description: Life & Death is a big, burly IPA from the Vocation Brewery in West Yorkshire. Great beer, great packaging. Thumbs up from us.

Name: Vocation Pride & Joy
Description: Pride & Joy is a splendid American-style Pale Ale from West Yorkshire produced by the Vocation Brewery (who seem to have quite an affection for the ampersand, looking at the names of all their beers).

Name: Chimay Gift Set with Glass
Description: A trio of Chimay beers, along with a glass to match! What a wonderful gift pack! It contains one of each of Chimay's stunning Belgian ales- Rouge, Triple and Bleue.

Name: Delirium Gift Pack With Glass
Description: A gift pack of Huyghe Brewery's most famous brew - Delirium Tremens! This comes with four bottles of the fantastic Belgian Blonde as well as a branded glass (with pink elephants on it!).

Name: Kwak Gift Pack with Glass
Description: Know someone who loves Kwak but lacks one of the very distinctive Kwak glasses which needs to held up by its own wooden stand?

Name: Westmalle Gift Pack with Glass
Description: A gift pack of Westmalle Trappist ales, including a bottle of their Dubbel, a bottle of their Tripel and a branded glass - a must for Belgian beer fans.

Name: Long Man Brewery Long Blonde
Description: A tasty golden ale from the Long Man Brewery, based in Sussex. Relaxed and wonderfully enjoyable.

Name: Long Man Brewery Best Bitter
Description: A yummy Best Bitter here from Sussex's Long Man Brewery - good balance of malt and hops with just a hint of sweetness to it...

Name: Long Man Brewery Old Man
Description: Rich, roast-y and slightly toasty dark old ale from the Long Man Brewery in Sussex. A definite comforting winter treat.

Name: Long Man Brewery American Pale Ale
Description: A hop-forward American-style Pale Ale brewed by the Long Man Brewery in beautiful Sussex.

Name: Whitstable Pilsner
Description: A Pilsner made with Saaz hops from Whitstable Brewery in Kent.

Name: Whitstable Oyster Stout
Description: An Oyster Stout from Whitstable Brewery, perfect enjoyed chilled with oysters as would have been commonplace in the 18th century. (Well, not the chilled bit...

Name: Whitstable Wheat Beer
Description: A spicy wheat beer from Whitstable Brewery near Maidstone in Kent.

Name: Whitstable Raspberry Wheat
Description: A cloudy wheat beer made with raspberries at Whitstable Brewery in Kent (the garden of England).

Name: Whitstable Brewery East India Pale Ale
Description: A 4.1% abv IPA from Whitstable Brewery in Kent.

Name: Whitstable Kentish Reserve
Description: Kentish Reserve is a premium bitter or ESB from a proud Kentish Brewery.

Name: Anchor Steam Beer
Description: The archetypal California Common, having trademarked the name Steam Beer, this modern brew from Anchor is made with lager yeast at temperatures more familiar in ale production.

Name: Big Hug Brewing Spirit Pale Ale
Description: A session Pale Ale from Big Hug, London brewers with a love of bears (for this brew inspiration has been taken from the amazing spirit bears of British Columbia).

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Gold
Description: Golden ale from Bristol Beer made with Pale, Cara, Crystal and Wheat malts alongside English hops.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Hefe
Description: A Hefeweizen-style (south German-style wheat) beer from Bristol, UK! Bristol Beer suggest enjoying this one alongside a salad or mild spicy dishes.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Independence
Description: An American-style pale with American hops added throughout the boil. It's also dry hopped, naturally.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Milk Stout
Description: A milk stout (made with unfermentable lactose sugar for added sweetness) brewed with Chocolate and Black malts as well as Maris Otter and Crystal.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Acer
Description: A hoppy session ale made with the late addition of Sorachi Ace by Bristol Beer, perfect for the summer.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Seven
Description: A Best bitter from Bristol Beer, made with Maris Otter malt and English Fuggles.

Name: Bristol Beer Factory Southville Hop
Description: A heavily hopped American-style beer influenced by the craft beers across the pond.

Name: Brooklyn Brewery Lager
Description: Dry hopped lager from Brooklyn Brewery. Great with pizza, barbecue, Mexican, cheeses, anything really! Presented in an American 355ml bottle.

Name: Dark Star Hophead
Description: A sessionable golden ale from Dark Star Brewing of Partridge Green.

Name: Dark Star Espresso
Description: A dark (pitch black) beer brewed with roasted malt, challenger hops and freshly ground Arabica coffee beans!

Name: Dark Star Sunburst
Description: A golden ale from Dark Star made with a proportion of malted rye as well as pale malted barley.

Name: Freedom Brewery Organic Helles
Description: A top quality organic lager from Freedom Brewery in Abbots Bromley.

Name: Freedom Pilsner Lager
Description: Refreshing 5% abv Pilsner from Freedom Brewery made with sweet malts and a blend of liberty and spicy Saaz hops.

Name: Harbour Brewing Pilsner
Description: A craft Pilsner from North Cornwall, made with the local Cornish spring water.

Name: Harbour Brewing Amber Ale
Description: Harbour, it has to be said, is an excellent name for a Cornish brewery. This is their Amber Ale.

Name: Harbour Brewing IPA
Description: An India Pale Ale from Cornwall, made with American hops.

Name: Harbour Brewing Pale Ale
Description: An American-style Pale Ale from North Cornwall's Harbour Brewing Company.

Name: Harbour Brewing Light Ale
Description: A light ale from Harbour Brewing from North Cornwall. Harbour light, geddit?

Name: Ilkley Pale Ale
Description: A great pale ale from Ilkley with Nelson Sauvin hoppy character.

Name: Ilkley Black
Description: A dark session beer from the excellent Ilkley Brewery made with 5 different malts. Try this one with sausage and mash.

Name: Ilkley Joshua Jane
Description: A nut brown Yorkshire ale given a hoppy Ilkley Brewery twist.

Name: Ilkley Mary Jane
Description: Probably not named after Peter Parker's girl next door, this is a session pale ale from Ilkley Brewery in Yorkshire made with plenty of yummy Amarillo hops.

Name: Little Creatures Pale Ale
Description: An Australian Pale Ale made with hops (from American and Australia) added throughout the boil, bottled at 5.2% abv.

Name: Maisel's Weisse Alkoholfrei
Description: An alcohol-free wheat beer from Germany, styled as a 'sporty' alternative with 40% less calories than their regular Weisse.

Name: Saltaire Cascade Pale Ale
Description: An American-style Pale Ale from Saltaire Brewery, near Bradford, which was established in 2005.

Name: Saltaire Raspberry Blonde
Description: A raspberry flavoured blonde ale from Saltaire Brewery near Bradford.

Name: Saltaire Blonde
Description: A Blonde from Bradford, brewed with Czech and German hops.

Name: Saltaire Hazelnut Coffee Porter
Description: This hazelnut flavoured English Porter is made with coffee and German malts and hops.

Name: Schneider Weisse Original
Description: Founded by Georg Schneider in 1872, the Bavarian brewing company is still in the hands of his descendants, producing classic wheat beer.

Name: Veltins Pilsener
Description: Classic German Pilsener from Meschede-Grevenstein made with natural mountain spring water.

Name: Wild Beer Wild Goose Chase
Description: Named after the fact that this was a much more difficult beer to create than was initially anticipated, Wild Goose Chase in Wild Beer's tart, fruity, well hopped any-time-of-beer par excellence.

Name: Wild Beer Epic Saison
Description: A Belgian-style farmhouse ale made with American Sorachi Ace in the West Country!

Name: Wild Beer Madness IPA
Description: Wild Beer's West Country take on a West Coast IPA! Made with lots of late hops and dry hopping. They recommend pairing with some top class cheddar from their neighbours at Westcombe Dairy.

Name: Wild Beer Millionaire
Description: Like beers from Wild Beer Co.? (They're pretty ace, right?) Like salted caramel? (Duh, it's like, the best thing. Obviously.

Name: Wild Beer Fresh Can
Description: A Pale Ale from Wild Beer made with hops from the northern and southern hemispheres.

Name: Wild Beer Ninkasi
Description: A beer with a great name, Ninkasi being the goddess of beer from Ancient Mesopotamia or Sumer dating back to the first ever recorded recipe (which was obviously for delicious beer) almost four

Name: Williams Brothers Joker IPA
Description: A \"Wickedly Hoppy\" IPA from Williams Brothers to bring a smile to you face.

Name: Williams Brothers Midnight Sun
Description: A Porter made with malted barley, oats, roast barley, chocolate malt, a bunch of hops and fresh root ginger!

Name: Williams Bros Birds & Bees
Description: A summer ale made with lager malt, hops and elderflower, perfect for early evenings with the sun still in the sky.

Name: Williams Brothers Seven Giraffes
Description: Seven Giraffes is an IPA made with 7 grains (Ale Malt, Lager Malt, Malted Wheat, Vienna Malt, Munich Malt, Pale Rye, Pale Crystal), 3 hop varieties, elderflower and lemon.

Name: Yeastie Boys Gunnamatta Earl Grey IPA
Description: The Yeastie Boys. Is there a better name for a brewing company? (The answer is no. No, there isn't.) So, what'cha what'cha what'cha want? What'cha want? How about an award-winning Earl Grey IPA?

Name: Yeastie Boys Pot Kettle Black
Description: Celebrated Porter from New Zealand, it's the award-winning Yeastie Boys Pot Kettle Black. So believe when I say they're no better than you, except when they brew so I guess it ain't true...

Name: Wild Beer Bibble
Description: 'Bibble', we are told, means \"to drink regularly\" in Somerset. Wild Beer Co. therefore decided this was the perfect name for this unfined 'everyday' beer!

Name: Wild Beer Fresh
Description: A can of Wild Beer's Pale Ale made every six months using the different available hops from different harvests from both the northern and southern hemispheres.

Name: Wild Beer Madness
Description: A can of Wild Beer's West Coast IPA made in the West Country with plenty of hops (added late plus dry hopping).

Name: Roosters Fort Smith
Description: An American-style Pale from Yorkshire, named after the town in which Rooster Cogburn lived. \"They say he has grit. I wanted a man with grit.

Name: Roosters Baby-Faced Assassin
Description: A deceptively drinkable India Pale Ala from Rooster's made with just one hop variety: Citra!

Name: Bedlam Golden Ale
Description: A light, fruity golden ale made with some roasted barley for body and hops which have plenty of influence without dominating.

Name: Bedlam Benchmark
Description: Bedlam Brewery's take on a Best ale, and very good it is too!

Name: Bedlam Porter
Description: Pale, Crystal, Brown and Chocolate malts are used to produce this Porter, with subtle hop influence.

Name: Bedlam Pilsner
Description: A Pilsner lager from Bedlam Brewery, near Brighton, made with a selection of hops including classic Saaz.

Name: Wiper and True Hard Shake Milk Stout 50cl
Description: A 'bigger' version of Wiper and True's Milk Shake Milk Stout, made with chocolate malts and vanilla. This is the larger 50cl bottling.

Name: Wylam Brewery Jakehead IPA
Description: An IPA \"supercharged\" with American hops at Wylam Brewery in Northumberland.

Name: By The Horns Wolfie Smith Urban Guerilla IPA
Description: Wolfie Smith is a well-hopped Amber Ale from London's By The Horns Brewing Co. Cracking label on this one...

Name: By The Horns Stiff Upper Lip Pale Ale
Description: A sessionable Pale Ale from the By The Horns Brewing Co. in London - yes, that might be one of our favourite named, too.

Name: Bad Seed Brewery Saison
Description: Superb Saison for the summer months here from the Bad Seed Brewery in North Yorkshire. Made using honey, ginger and grains of paradise to give its flavour profile some handsome additions.

Name: Bad Seed Brewery IPA
Description: From North Yorkshire's Bad Seed Brewery comes their rather wonderful IPA, packed full of Chinook, Cascade and Columbus hops. Bad Seed, good beer.

Name: The Park Brewery Spankers IPA
Description: From Kingston-Upon-Thames based Park Brewery comes their Spankers IPA, named after Spankers Hill Wood. Yep. Dry-hopped and dee-lish!

Name: 360° Brewing Project Gemini v1.0
Description: From the 360° Brewing chaps in Uckfield, comes the Gemini Project twin-hop session Pale Ale, which is made using hop pairing which change with each batch.

Name: TicketyBrew Coffee Anise Porter
Description: A rich, decadent Porter from the Stalybridge based brewers, Tickeybrew. Combines the dark malts of a Porter along with coffee as well as anise - which is rather interesting indeed...

Name: TicketyBrew Dubbel
Description: One of the first beers brewed by the TicketyBrew team in Stalybridge - A Belgian-Trappist-style Dubbel!

Name: TicketyBrew Münchner
Description: A traditional style of German beer, made by the TicketyBrew folks in Stalybridge!

Name: TicketyBrew Pale Ale
Description: This is TicketyBrew's Pale Ale, produced in Stalybridge using American hops and Belgian yeast.

Name: TicketyBrew Stout
Description: From the TicketyBrew team in Stalybridge comes a rather yummy Stout, made with their Belgian yeast.

Name: TicketyBrew Tripel
Description: This is TicketyBrew's Tripel beer, to compliment their lovely Dubbel! Ace Trappist-style deliciousness...

Name: Arbor Argy Bargy
Description: Argy Bargy is a collaborative Barleywine made by Arbor Ales from Bristol, Steel City Brewing from Sheffield and Hopcraft Brewing from Pontyclun.

Name: Arbor Monsoon Saison
Description: From the Arbor Ales folks in Bristol comes their tasty Monsoon Saison (top marks for the wordplay, team!).

Name: Arbor Oz Bomb
Description: Oz Bomb is an Australian-styled Pale Ale from the Arbor brewers in Bristol. They've used Australian Galaxy and Vic Secret hops for this on, in generous measures.

Name: Arbor The Devil Made Me Brew It
Description: A dry-hopped Stout from Bristol-based brewers, Arbor! This is made with Bramling Cross hops, and is dry-hopped with Citra, Simcoe, Bravo and Mosaic hops too.

Name: Fourpure Northern Latitude
Description: Fourpure's Northern Latitude is a wonderful winter treat - a red rye ale which has been brewed with brown sugar!

Name: Fourpure Southern Latitude
Description: Southern Latitude one half of a duo from Fourpure Brewing Co. in London (can you guess what the other half is?

Name: Birrificio Italiano Cassissona
Description: An Italian fruit beer from Birrificio, brewed with blackcurrants to give it a sweet, juicy personality.

Name: Big Hug Hibernation White IPA
Description: Big Hug Brewing are a wonderful bunch based in London who do their brewing at other breweries, armed with their own ace recipes.

Name: Mad Hatter Cherry Scotch Ale
Description: Sweet, fruity Scotch ale from the Mad Hatter Brewing Company in Liverpool. Loads of yummy sweetness to it, with a touch of sour cherry hiding in there...

Name: Mad Hatter Down The Rabbit Hole
Description: A big-bodied red ale from Liverpool's Mad Hatter Brewing Co., made with a bustling bounty of hops and bottle at a rather robust 8.4% ABV.

Name: Mad Hatter Mild Life Crisis
Description: Mild Life Crisis is a rather delicious Mild from the folks at Mad Hatter Brewing Co. in Liverpool, brewed in celebration of their Head Brewer Gaz Matthews' 40th birthday!

Name: Mad Hatter Salted Caramel Quadrupel
Description: You know how salted caramel anything is pretty much always delicious? Well, here we has Mad Hatter Brewing Co.'s Salted Caramel Quadrupel.

Name: Mad Hatter Soleil De Glace
Description: Soleil De Glace is a well-hopped Double IPA from the Mad Hatter Brewing Co. in Liverpool. Huge hop influence with this one - dee-lish!

Name: Mad Hatter Stocky Stout
Description: Mad Hatter's Stocky Stout is something of a reference to the days of 'stock ale'. Dark, roast-y and just generally yummy.

Name: Mad Hatter Wapping Mad
Description: A light, somewhat creamy amber ale from Liverpool's excellent Mad Hatter Brewing Co., who not only have tasty beers but some really rather wonderful labels too.

Name: Mad Hatter Double Nightmare on Bold Street
Description: From Liverpool's Mad Hatter Brewing Company, based in Liverpool's Baltic Triangle, comes the Double Nightmare!

Name: Northern Monk Northern Industry
Description: A collaborative dark ale from the Northern Monk Brewing Co. in Leeds. However, they've not collaborated with another brewery - they've collaborated with a local record label!

Name: Summer Wine The Kiwi
Description: The Kiwi is an IPA from the Summer Wine Brewing team made with a pair of New Zealand hops - a bright, juicy and delicious beer (all adjectives which could be shared with the wonderful kiwi fruit!).

Name: Summer Wine Oregon West Coast Pale Ale
Description: Summer Wine Brewery's Oregon West Coast Pale Ale shows off the gloriousness of the Cascade hop!

Name: Summer Wine Brewing Sabertooth IPA
Description: The Summer Wine Brewery's Sabertooth IPA has come roaring into Mom Towers! Made with Summit and Columbus hops, this is ready to pounce with hoppy goodness, joined by a hint of malt on the tail.

Name: Tuatara Solstice 2015 Tribute
Description: A Spiced Saison in celebration of the Solstice! This intriguing tipple comes from the Tuatara Brewery in New Zealand, and has been brewed with ginger and Kaffir lime leaves.

Name: Wild Beer The Blend Summer 2015
Description: The Blend Summer from Somerset's Wild Beer Co. is a interesting blend of a bunch of different cask-aged sour beers, including some barrels from their first ever sour brew!

Name: Wild Beer Modus Operandi
Description: A gloriously rich wild yeast beer from the Wild Beer Co. in Somerset. Named Modus Operandi, this does somewhat encapsulate a big part of what the brewers do - make some cracking wild beers!

Name: Wild Beer Shnoodlepip 2015
Description: Shnoodlepip is the incredibly enjoyable to pronounce collaboration between the Wild beer Co., Good George Beer's Kelly Ryan and Burning Sky Brewery's Mark Tranter.

Name: Wild Beer The Blend - Winter 2015 (Beyond Modus II)
Description: This winter treat from the Wild Beer Co. in Somerset is based around a vintage barrel of their Modus Operandi wild yeast beer, though the blend itself is much richer and darker than before...

Name: Wild Beer III
Description: A juicy, sweet barley wine from the Wild Beer Co. in Somerset, packed to the brim of fruity deliciousness.

Name: Wild Beer Witness
Description: The Wild Beer Co.'s Witness is a Belgian-style Brett pale ale inspired by the beers of the Trappist monasteries. Ought to cellar well...

Name: Wild Beer Wildebeest
Description: From Somerset's Wild Beer Co. comes the Wildebeest!

Name: Renaissance Grandmaster IPA
Description: A \"fresh-hop\" Double IPA here from New Zealand's Renaissance Brewery.

Name: Renaissance Boom! Double IPA
Description: Boom! is a delicious Double IPA from the Renaissance Brewery in New Zealand. Big ol' blasts of hoppy goodness are the star of the show with the brew.

Name: Renaissance Collision Course
Description: Collision Course is made by the Renaissance Brewery in New Zealand in a very similar way to an IPA, except that they use lager yeast and they lager it - y'know, like they would a lager!

Name: Renaissance Voyager
Description: From New Zealand-based brewery Renaissance comes the Voyager IPA, made with a combination of Riwaka and Fuggles hops.

Name: Renaissance Fresh Hop Black The RIPA
Description: From the Renaissance Brewery's Enlightenment range comes Black the RIPA, a Black Rye IPA. Get it? Clever.

Name: Three Boys Pils
Description: A Pilsner from New Zealand, made with aromatic Kiwi Saaz hops!

Name: Burning Sky Saison à la Provision
Description: For their Saison a la Provision, Burning Sky use Saison yeast for the primary fermentation and use Lactobacillus and Brettanomyces for a secondary fermentation.

Name: Burning Sky Cuvée 2016
Description: Somewhere between a creamy Saison and a classic Belgian Lambic lies the Burning Sky Cuvée - tasty stuff from the Firle-based brewers. They use beer from their Foudre no.

Name: Bad Co. Wild Gravity
Description: Hugely fruity IPA from Bad Co. - loads of tropical, hoppy, zesty, yummy goodness to be had here.

Name: Bad Co. Love Over Gold
Description: A mellow, creamy, great-for-the-summer Blonde ale from Bad Co. in the north of England.

Name: Bad Co. Dazed & Confused
Description: Dazed & Confused is Bad Co.'s tasty Milk Stout, packed with bountiful notes of fruit, coffee, chocolate and (of course) milk.

Name: Bad Co. Comfortably Numb
Description: A tasty treat from Bad Co. in the north of England - a particularly hop-packed golden ale, this one! No prizes for knowing what band has a song with the same name as this beer.

Name: Yeastie Boys xeRRex
Description: xeRRex from the Yeastie Boys is an imperial strength bottling of their Rex Attitude heavily-peated ale - yes, you read that right!

Name: Yeastie Boys Digital IPA
Description: A new world twist on the classic IPA by the Yeastie Boys, made with Motueka, Nelson Sauvin and Southern Cross hops - it's also dry-hopped.

Name: Yeastie Boys Cloudbuster
Description: Gloriously refreshing Saison from New Zealand's Yeastie Boys, perfect for sunny afternoons...

Name: Yeastie Boys Stairdancer
Description: A very laid-back Pale Ale from the Yeastie Boys selection, made with a combination of golden malts and tasty hops including Pacifica, Nelson Sauvin and Southern Cross.

Name: 8 Wired Batch 2.18
Description: To celebrate their 18th batch in their Warkworth brewery, New Zealand's 8 Wired Brewing Co. produced Batch 2.

Name: 8 Wired Sour Side Of The Moon
Description: 8 Wired call their Sour Side of the Moon a 'Flanders Black Ale', and it has been aged in Pinot Noir barrels. Not something you see every day, is it?

Name: 8 Wired Wireless Black IPA
Description: A 100% Brett Black IPA from the 8 Wired Brewing Co. in New Zealand. A rather uncommon combination of styles - very interesting indeed.

Name: 8 Wired Tall Poppy
Description: A very impressive red ale from the 8 Wired Brewing Co. in New Zealand, featuring Amarillo, Simcoe, Columbus and Warrior hops bringing bundles of bittersweet goodness.

Name: Tuatara Sauvinova
Description: A single hop Pale Ale from New Zealand's Tuatara - Sauvinova is focussed around the exciting, fascinating flavours of the Nelson Sauvin hop.

Name: Tuatara Outrigger
Description: A refreshing South Pacific Pale Ale from New Zealand-based brewers, Tuatara. Made with a whole host of hops, resulting in oodles of fresh citrus, mango and vanilla biscuit notes.

Name: Tuatara Black Mojo Espresso Stout
Description: A collaborative Espresso Stout, made by New Zealand's Tuatara and Mojo Coffee.

Name: Magic Rock Rapture
Description: Superb Amber Ale from Magic Rock Brewing in Huddersfield, combining 5 different malts and 6 hops.

Name: Magic Rock Dark Arts
Description: A particularly excellent Stout here from Magic Rock Brewing in Huddersfield, made with a combination of four malts and plenty of hops - meaning the classic coffee and chocolate notes shine, with

Name: Wild Beer Somerset Wild
Description: While Somerset might be more well-known for its cider (as our Sam will only be too keen to tell you), the Wild Beer Co.

Name: Wild Beer Sleeping Lemons
Description: Sleeping Lemons is the Wild Beer Co.'s intriguing Gose beer, which has been brewed with lemon that were preserved in salt and lemon juice, making for a great combination of savoury and sourness.

Name: Wild Beer Sourdough
Description: A German Weisee-style beer from the the South West's Wild Beer Co., made with a 58 year old sourdough yeast! Intense stuff!

Name: Thornbridge Jaipur
Description: A rather classically style IPA from the Thornbridge Brewery in Derbyshire.

Name: Thornbridge Tart Bakewell Sour
Description: A \"Bakewell Sour\" from the Thornbridge Brewery, made in collaboration with the Wild Beer Co. in the South West!

Name: Thornbridge Rhubarbe De Saison
Description: Superb Saison, complimented with tart sparks of rhubarb! A fantastic beer for the warmer months from the Thornbridge Brewery.

Name: Thornbridge I Love You Will You Marry Me
Description: Aww. Thornbridge Brewery's I Love You Will You Marry Me is a Belgian style Blonde ale which has been matured with a generous helping of strawberries! Great for the summer!

Name: Thornbridge Eldon Stout
Description: The Thornbridge Brewery's Eldon is a pretty fantastic Imperial Stout which has been brewed with Demerara sugar, and also features notes of bourbon-soaked oak.

Name: Thornbridge AM:PM Session IPA
Description: AM:PM is a sessinoable IPA from the Thornbridge Brewery, packed with fresh tropical fruit flavours.

Name: DeuS Brut des Flandres Cuvée Prestige 2015
Description: Brewed at Bosteels, Belgium and then sent to Champagne to be treated like a fine sparkling wine, this is truly a beer for special occasions!

Name: Lowlander White Ale
Description: A Dutch wheat beer here from the Lowlander range, which is inspired by the botanicals brought to the Netherlands over the years.

Name: Lowlander IPA
Description: The lowlander range takes its inspiration from all of the wonderful herbs, spices, fruit and other deliciousness which has been transported to the Netherlands over the years.

Name: Lowlander Poorter
Description: Lowlander Poorter is a delicious treat from the Dutch range, brewed with vanilla and liquorice.

Name: Whitstable Kentish Lager
Description: A refreshing lager from the Maidstone-based Whitstable Brewery, made with Saaz hops. Enjoy well-chilled on a warm evening.

Name: And Union Unfiltered Lager
Description: A creamy, refreshing unfiltered lager or (\"UNFLT LAGER\" as the label calls it) from And Union. Very tasty and goes well with spicy foods.

Name: And Union Neu Blk
Description: An unfiltered dark lager from the And Union brewers, with generous helpings of roasted malt goodness.

Name: And Union Steph Weiss
Description: The Steph Weiss from And Union is a Bavarian-styled wheat beer, brimming with vanilla and clove notes alongside juicy lemon sweetness. Excellent summer sipping.

Name: And Union Summer Wheat Ale
Description: When it comes to summer beers, you can't go wrong with a cold, refreshing wheat beer, and the folks from And Union know this very well indeed, judging by their excellent Summer Wheat Ale!

Name: And Union Friday IPA
Description: Would you look at this - it's Friday IPA (sung to the tune of that Cure song). Delicious Well-hopped beer from And Union.

Name: And Union Der Graf von Bayern
Description: A low alcohol Bavarian wheat beer here from And Union - they set out to make a low alcohol beer which maintains its aroma, body and flavour, and they've certainly done well here.

Name: And Union Sunday Pale Ale
Description: \"Because I'm easy... Easy like Sunday Easy Pale Ale from And Union, made with a combination of Hallertau Aroma and American hops...\" Or however that song goes.

Name: And Union Beast of the Deep
Description: Beast of the Deep is a tasty unfiltered Imperial Lager from And Union, made with Hallertau Aroma hops.

Name: BrewDog Elvis Juice V2.0 IPA
Description: V2.0 sees BrewDog work to incorporate those additional citrus fruit flavours to already citrusy IPA without this time dramatically altering the pH.

Name: Alnwick IPA
Description: A traditionally styled IPA from the Alnwick Brewery, which was relaunched in 2007 after 50 years of absence and is based on the recipe produced all the way back then.

Name: Alnwick Brown Ale
Description: A classic Tyne and Wear brown ale given a fuller body by the chaps at Alnwick Brewery.

Name: Alnwick Gold
Description: A creamy golden ale from the Alnwick Brewery made with Maris Otter malts and First Gold hops - excellent summer afternoon drinking.

Name: Lindisfarne Holy Island Bitter
Description: An aptly named bitter from the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, about a mile off the coast of Northumberland.

Name: Beavertown Bloody 'Ell Blood Orange IPA
Description: Beavertown's Bloody 'Ell is a fantastic IPA which has been loaded up with masses of citrus-y hops and blood orange.

Name: BrewDog Born To Die 18.08.2016
Description: Channelling Greg Koch's Stone Enjoy by... series, BrewDog present a \"terminally\" super dry hopped (even more so than their usual beers) 8.5% abv short-lifespan IPA!

Name: BrewDog Monk Hammer
Description: BrewDog's Monk Hammer is very similar to their excellent Jack Hammer IPA, though this time they've put a bit of a spin on it by fermenting the Monk Hammer with Belgian yeast!

Name: BrewDog Shipwreck
Description: BrewDog's Ship Wreck is very much like a cross between a beer and a mezcal - it's a strong ale which has been brewed using smoked malt, as well as smoked agave syrup!

Name: Magic Rock Inhaler
Description: Magic Rock's Inhaler is packed with oodles of hops, including Citra, Simcoe, Mosaic, Equinox, Galaxy and Amarillo. They call it a 'Juicy Pale Ale', and that's a very fitting name indeed for this brew.

Name: Moor Beer Company Hoppiness
Description: A flavoursome IPA from the south-west-based Moor Beer Co., packing a hearty wallop of hoppy goodness alongside full-bodied, fruity malts.

Name: Weird Beard Five O'Clock Shadow
Description: Five O'Clock Shadow is an American-styled IPA from the Weird Beard Brew Co., combining a bundle of pungent hops with crisp malt notes.

Name: Weird Beard Mariana Trench
Description: By combining American Citra hops with Pacific Gem hops from New Zealand, the Weird Beard Brew Co.

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. Jolly Rodger 2013
Description: The Jolly Rodger is a yearly release from Drake's Brewing Co. in California - each year the recipe changes, with the 2013 edition being a well-hopped black ale.

Name: Evil Twin Calypso
Description: This is Evil Twin's Calypso, which boasts a mouthful of a description - it's a Single Hop Imperial India Pale American Wheat Lager! Phew.

Name: Hawkshead NZPA
Description: A taste of New Zealand via Cumbria - it's the Hawkshead Brewery's NZPA (or New Zealand Pale Ale).

Name: Northern Monk Northern Star
Description: Massively rich and flavoursome Mocha Porter from Northern Monk, made in collaboration with the North Star Coffee Roasters in Leeds.

Name: Dark Star APA
Description: Dark Star APA Can uses a yeast strain specially imported from the USA, Maris Otter malt to provide a light colour and dryness, and Cascade, Centennial and Chinook hops for an American pale ale with

Name: Dark Star Revelation
Description: Dark Star Revelation is an American-style pale ale that goes heavy on the hops.

Name: Magic Rock High Wire
Description: A tribute to the Pale Ales of America's west coast from Huddersfield's Magic Rock Brewing, made with six varieties of hop resulting in massive fresh fruit flavours.

Name: Wild Beer Sleeping Lemons Export
Description: A higher ABV variation on the Wild Beer Co.'s Sleeping Lemons Gose, made with lemons preserved in salt and lemon juice!

Name: Thornbridge Bear State
Description: West Coast-style IPA from Derbyshire's Thornbridge Brewery, brewed with a generous helping of wonderful hops.

Name: Thornbridge Chiron
Description: Thornbridge Brewery have attempted to brew a well-balanced pale ale of sophistication and complexity, which explains the slightly curious name.

Name: Van Bulck Organic Blonde Beer
Description: An unfiltered organic Belgian beer brewed at D’Proef with barley, wheat and spelt as well as orange peel and coriander.

Name: Van Bulck Organic Wild Fruit Beer
Description: An organic Belgian fruit beer made with cherries, pomegranate, raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, grapefruit and blackberries.

Name: Fallen Brewing Local Motive Session IPA
Description: A Mosaic-dry-hopped session IPA from the Fallen Brewing Folks in Stirlingshire, Scotland.

Name: Chorlton Brewing Co. Amarillo Sour
Description: A tasty sour beer from the Manchester-based Chorlton Brewing Company, inspired by the brews of Germany. Twice fermented and dry-hopped to give it some fragrant hoppy notes.

Name: Chorlton Brewing Co. Citra Brett Pale
Description: A deliciously complex Brett beer here from the Chorlton Brewery Company in Manchester, which has been dry-hopped too...

Name: Brew By Numbers 19|01 Gose
Description: The Brew By Numbers crew have taken a leaf out of 16th century Germany's books by creating their very own Gose beer!

Name: BrewDog Ace Of Chinook
Description: A single hop varietal IPA from BrewDog, giving light to the glory of the Chinook hop!

Name: BrewDog Hop Fiction
Description: BrewDog's Hop Fiction is an American Pale Ale which shows off some very fruity hop notes, coming solely from early and late hops. Great as a summer afternoon brew.

Name: Brewdog Prototype Milk Stout
Description: It's BrewDog's Jet Black Heart before it became Jet Black Heart!

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:20
Description: For the 20th brew in the Abstrakt range, BrewDog have created what they describe as their \"interpretation of the classic Italian Tiramisu dessert\".

Name: BrewDog Barrel-Aged Albino Squid Assassin
Description: The squid that's armed to the teeth is back, and this time, it's barrel-aged! Yes, BrewDog have aged their Albino Squid Assassin red rye IPA in rye whiskey casks - a very apt choice.

Name: Mikkeller Skør Barrel Aged
Description: A cask-aged edition of Mikkeller's Skør Belgian ale - it's been rested in red wine casks which has imparted further fruity, chocolatey notes.

Name: Mikkeller Vild Barrel Aged
Description: A barrel-aged Belgian-style strong ale from the excellent Mikkeller, brewed at D’Proef in Belgium and bottled at 12.3% abv! This is a 37.5cl bottle.

Name: Mikkeller Better Half IPA Can
Description: A well hopped American IPA from Danish gypsy brewer extraordinaire Mikkeller.

Name: Mikkeller Black Imperial Stout
Description: A very strong imperial stout from Mikkeller, brewed at De Proef in Belgium. Made with roasted barley, dark brown sugar and Champagne yeast, it will cellar extremely well for years. This is a 37.

Name: Mikkeller Crooked Moon Imperial IPA
Description: A \"violently hoppy\" double IPA from Mikkeller, collaborating this time with Crooked Moon tattoo studio in Sweden!

Name: Mikkeller Hva Såå!?
Description: \"Hva sååååååå!? is the new Årh Hvad?!\

Name: Mikkeller Mexas Ranger
Description: A Porter made with almond milk, chillies, black beans, corn, avocado leaves and cocoa, aged in Tequila barrels! A taste of Mexico from Mikkeller.

Name: Mikkeller Peter, Pale And Mary
Description: An American Pale Ale from Mikkeller, with a cheeky reference to Peter, Paul & Mary in its name.

Name: Mikkeller Porter
Description: A Porter beer from Mikkeller, a very well-loved brewing outfit in the craft beer world.

Name: Mikkeller Ramen To Bíiru
Description: A Belgian ale fermented with Brettanomyces, brewed by Mikkeller for the ramen restaurant Ramen To Bíiru, opened by Mikkeller and Bento Copenhagen.

Name: Mikkeller Raspberry Trippelbock
Description: This is a Trippelbock from the Mikkeller folks, with a hearty helping of raspberries at its core. A perfect pudding beer. Presented in a 37.5cl bottle.

Name: Mikkeller SpontanCassis
Description: The SpontanCassis from Mikkeller is a sour beer which has been made with blackcurrants added while brewing was under way.

Name: Mikkeller Tommi's Beeger Joint
Description: A rye beer from Mikkeller, made in collaboration with Tommi's Burger Joint in Copenhagen! The man behind Tommi's is Tómas Á.

Name: BrewDog Elvis Juice
Description: BrewDog have refined their recipe for their Elvis Juice IPA, and this is the delicious result - a refreshing treat which has been brewed with oodles of grapefruit peel!

Name: Adnams Ease Up IPA
Description: A 4.6% abv full-flavoured IPA from Adnams made with lager malt, oats, munich and cara alongside a host of tasty hops.

Name: Jupiler Pils
Description: When you've had a couple of rounds of Belgian style quadrupel beers (courtesy of your Belgian friend - let's call him Morgan) in the Deliriumm Cafe in Brussels, you need a light, refreshing pilsner.

Name: The Kernel Export India Porter (6%)
Description: A 6% abv bottling of The Kernel's rich, hoppy Porter!

Name: Einstök Icelandic White Ale (Euro 2016 Limited Edition)
Description: A limited edition presentation of Einstök's excellent Icelandic White Ale, celebrating the UEFA Euro 2016 football championship.

Name: Lindemans Kriek (25cl)
Description: Lambic beer made with whole sour cherries? Oh, yes.

Name: Northern Monk Communion
Description: When you hear the term 'collaborative beer' you usually think it's a collaboration between two breweries. Not this time. Communion is a collaborative pale ale between the Northern Monk Brew Co.

Name: Northern Monk Heathen IPA
Description: A big-bodied, well hopped IPA from the Northern Monk Brew Co., packed full of Citra hops!

Name: Northern Monk New World IPA
Description: A rather tasty IPA produced by the Northern Monk Brew Co., which have been brewed using British pale malts along with 5 varieties of hop.

Name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
Description: An American Porter from the Redhook Brewing Co., which they first brewed back in the 1980s, when the American craft brewing scene was kicking off.

Name: To Øl Fuck Art This Is Architecture
Description: From To Øl's Fuck Art series comes their Fuck Art This is Architecture Belgian farmhouse pale ale, which is very well hopped and fermented with brettanomyces to give it a hearty funky element.

Name: To Øl Insane In The Grain
Description: While hops are usually the focus of an IPA, interestingly the Danish brewed have focussed on the grains of this IPA!

Name: To Øl Kex
Description: A rather hoppy Pilsner brewed by To Øl for the Kex Hostel in Reykjavik, Iceland. They brew this using Amarillo, Mosaic and Tettnanger hops, as well as with biscuits!

Name: To Øl LikeWeisse Berliner
Description: Some cracking word-play going on here with To Øl's LikeWeisse Berliner wheat beer. Oh, and it's a cracking beer too, brewed with Motueka and Citra hops.

Name: To Øl Mine Is Bigger Than Yours
Description: An absolutely huge barley wine from To Øl, with a rather boastful name to match its massive flavour profile.

Name: To Øl Mr. Blonde
Description: For their Mr. Blonde Belgian IPA, To Øl brewed this beer using gooseberries - which ought to boost the fruity hop notes...

Name: To Øl Rød Grød Med Fløde
Description: A very fruity IPA from To Øl, named after a Danish pudding which is notoriously hard to pronounce.

Name: To Øl Sur Mosaic
Description: Sur is Danish for 'sour', and this is a sour mashed pale ale from To Øl. It's also made, of course, with wonderful Mosaic hops.

Name: To Øl Sundancer
Description: A perfect all-summer sipper from To Øl, brewed at De Proef. Made with lager yeast but at warmer temperatures like a California Common with some wheat also used alongside the barley.

Name: To Øl Põhjala
Description: A gose that was inspired by gin! Intrigued yet?

Name: Old Worthy So Hipster it Hurts
Description: Banana bread rye ale? With a squirrel in a shirt with a moustache and a monocle on a penny farthing on the label? It's So Hipster it Hurts.

Name: Old Worthy Leithers' Cure for Scurvy
Description: A whisky-infused marmalade pale ale! Infused, in fact, with our very own Glen Garioch 20 Year Old 1993 - Single Cask! Old Worthy's ales are designed to be paired with whisky (for a Half 'n' Half).

Name: Old Worthy Who Drank My Porridge?
Description: A coffee and oat white stout from the excellent Old Worthy Brewing Co. Old Worthy's ales are designed to be paired with whisky (for a Half 'n' Half).

Name: Big Peat Cask Matured Ale
Description: Produced in partnership with Douglas Laing, this beer from Islay Ales was aged in ex-Big Peat Islay whisky casks!

Name: BrewDog Kingpin
Description: BrewDog take special pride over their lagers, a cold-conditioned style of beer certainly doesn't need to be as bland and dull as many of the international brands that tend to dominate shop shelves and

Name: Brewdog Paradox Islay Imperial Stout
Description: We love these Paradox whisky cask aged imperial stouts from BrewDog as they cater for our inner whisky geek and beer geek at the same time!

Name: Brewdog Electric India
Description: A spring ale that combines elements of Belgian saison and American IPA as well as crushed peppercorns and heather honey, BrewDog recommend this with barbecued food!

Name: BrewDog Black Hammer
Description: This is the second release in the Hammer Head range, a series of IPAs each with a single twist that makes them different to BrewDog's excellent Jack Hammer.

Name: Mikkeller Schwarzbier
Description: \"Henry has gone full mental.\" Apparently. This is a Schwarzbier from Mikkeler brewed at D’Proef in Belgium. A light dark beer (still with us?).

Name: Beavertown Applelation Bramley Apple Saison
Description: An 8.7% apple saison that treads the ground between a beer and a sparking wine.

Name: Beavertown Quelle Farmhouse Pale
Description: Dry-hopped Saison from the Beavertown chaps in London! An excellent combination of styles, with pale ale bitterness and fruity, yeasty saison elements.

Name: Moor Beer Company Agent Of Evil
Description: This tasty brew from the Moor Beer Company is a \"Black IPA celebrating the Dark Side of the Force\

Name: Moor Beer Company Guardian Of Peace
Description: From the Moor Beer Company in Somerset comes an IPA that is \"celebrating the Light Side of the Force\

Name: Weird Beard Attack Of The Ryeclops
Description: Attack of the Ryeclops is a rye pale ale from the wonderful Weird Beard Brew Co., which complements the spicy rye with Columbus, Equinox and Chinook hops.

Name: Mikkeller The Beer Traveller
Description: A barrel aged collaboration between Mikkeller and Carsten Berthelsen, a well-known beer writer and international beer judge.

Name: BeerbleFish Holy Smoke
Description: Another great Admiral brew from Beerblefish, in fact Holy Smoke is made with just this single hop varietal.

Name: BeerbleFish Admiral Hopper
Description: A beer named after US Rear Admiral Grace Hopper, or 'Amazing Grace', the quite extraordinary pioneering computer programmer.

Name: BeerbleFish E.S.B.
Description: An E.S.B. (Extra Special/Strong Bitter) that combines traditional British Fuggles with Dr. Rudi hops from New Zealand as well as Citra.

Name: BeerbleFish Willoughby Stout
Description: An interesting stout from Beerblefish Brewing Company who have their own malt-guarding cat called Ozric or 'Ozzy' much like many distilleries have their own mousers.

Name: BeerbleFish Iteration Pale Ale
Description: A traditional IPA from Beerblefish Brewing that weighs in at 5.9% abv and uses Admiral hops.

Name: BeerbleFish Final Countdown
Description: Final Countdown from Europe. Britain, in fact. It's brewed in London. Yes, this is a beer what did you think we were talking about? This is a robust pale ale from Beerblefish made with British hops.

Name: Beavertown Bloody Notorious Blood Orange DIPA
Description: A rather glorious collaboration between the Beavertown Brewery in London and Boneyard Brewing in Bend, Oregon, continuing on the 'massive orange' influence of Beavertown's Bloody 'Elll and Boneyard's

Name: Beavertown Lupuloid IPA
Description: Beavertown's Lupuloid is the London-based brewery's first \"straight up IPA\

Name: BrewDog Ace of Citra
Description: A single hop IPA from BrewDog's 'Ace of...' series. This one shows off one of the most popular hops among craft beer enthusiasts - the mighty Citra hop!

Name: BrewDog Chili Hammer
Description: A \"Ruthless Chili IPA\" from the BrewDog chaps, made with Habanero, Scotch Bonnet and Trinidad Scorpion peppers! They also dry-hop this beer to help develop balancing notes of fresh citrus and mango.

Name: BrewDog Neon Overlord
Description: \"I, for one, welcome our new Neon Overlord...\"\r\n\r\nNeon Overlord is one of a pair of IPAs from BrewDog released in the latter half of 2016 which feature chili at their core!

Name: Fierce Beer Day Shift
Description: A well-hopped pale ale from Scotland's Fierce Beer, brewed using Summit and Chinook hops. Intense hoppy notes, though still rather sessionable.

Name: Fierce Beer Peanut Riot
Description: From Scotland's Fierce Beer folks comes their Peanut Riot porter, brewed with Summit, Nugget, Columbus and Galacy hops.

Name: Fierce Beer Granadilla Guerilla
Description: West Coast style IPA from Fierce Beer brewed with Summit and Chinook hops as well as passion fruit. Top stuff for enjoying on warm afternoons.

Name: Soundwaves Island Records Session IPA
Description: Music label Island Records have gone and got their own beer! Made by Soundwaves Brewing at the Two Tribes Brewery, this session IPA boasts big hop influence and oodles of tropical fruit notes.

Name: Hawkshead Cumbrian 5 Hop
Description: A generously hopped beer from the Hawkshead Brewery in Cumbria, made with a combination of 5 different hop varieties (as you might have guessed from the name).

Name: Hawkshead Solar Sour
Description: Solar Sour from the Hawkshead Brewery in Cumbria is a wonderfully refreshing Berliner Weisse made with Tettnang hops. It was first brewed on the day of a solar eclipse, inspiring the name.

Name: Magic Rock Common Grounds
Description: A 'Triple Coffee Porter' from Magic Rock in Huddersfield, made with 7 different malts and 7 different coffees!

Name: Wild Beer POGO
Description: A deliciously fruity Pale Ale from the Wild Beer Co., with a name inspired by a popular past-time at brewery - jumping on a pogo stick!

Name: Old Worthy Wild Bill's Aces & Eights
Description: A salted-chocolate porter from Old Worthy, made to pair deliciously with American oak matured single malt Scotch. Rather light for a porter, and absolutely packed with character.

Name: BrewDog Elvis Juice Can
Description: BrewDog's grapefruit infused IPA Elvis Juice is now available in small metal cylinders (commonly known as \"cans\").

Name: Old Worthy Roll Your RRR's
Description: A delicious ale from the Old Worthy range, combining notes of rum, raisins and rye!

Name: Schlenkerla Rauchbier Weizen
Description: A German wheat Rauchbier, or smoked beer if you will. It's made using the Schlenkerla smokemalt and unsmoked wheat.

Name: Innis and Gunn IPA Oak Aged Beer
Description: A limited edition oak aged India Pale Ale from Innis and Gunn. These are aged in oak for 55 days, and the results are deeply rich and fruity.

Name: Lost and Grounded Keller Pils
Description: German Pilsner malt and a trio of hops combine marvellously to create Bristol-based Lost and Grounded's Keller Pils. A simple but smashing brew.

Name: Lost and Grounded Running with Sceptres
Description: A surprisingly heavily-hopped lager from Bristol-based Lost and Grounded, featuring a pretty bloomin' fantastic illustration on the label. That pelican is holding a sceptre in its beak!

Name: Lost and Grounded Hop-Hand Fallacy
Description: Refreshing farmhouse-style beer from the Lost and Grounded folks in Bristol, made with Brewers Gold and Crystal hops alongside orange peel and coriander.

Name: Weird Beard Hops Maiden England
Description: West London's Weird Beard Brew Co. make their Hops Maiden England using UK hops. It's backed up by a mash bill full of oats to give the hops a stage to show off.

Name: Howling Hops Bohemian Lager
Description: After spells brewing underneath both The Cock Tavern in Hackney and The Southampton Arms in Kentish Town, Howling Hops moved to their current site in Hackney Wick in 2015 - a large Victorian warehouse

Name: Howling Hops Pale Ale
Description: Pineapples are generally good things, right? I mean, they may not really belong on pizza (according to some!), but they sure do liven up gammon...

Name: Howling Hops IPA West Coast Special
Description: We've not looked into it properly, but it could well be illegal for UK microbreweries not to produce a West Coast American IPA style beer... Either that, or they're just absurdly fashionable!

Name: Fourpure Juicebox Citrus IPA
Description: A massively citrus-y IPA from the Fourpure folks, made with a combination of Citra (of course), Cascade, Mandarina Bavaria and Flaconer's Flight hops, and brewed with fresh orange peel too.

Name: Fourpure Flatiron American Red Ale
Description: An American style red ale from the folks at Fourpure in Bermondsey. Expect big flavours and a wonderful balance!

Name: Mondo Rider Pale Ale
Description: Catch a ride to America via London with the Mondo Brewing Co.'s Rider Pale Ale, made with plenty of citrus-forward American hops.

Name: Mondo Kemosabe IPA
Description: A deliciously hoppy IPA from London's Mondo Brewing Co., features a trio of hops - Columbus, Cascade and Centennial. As Tonto would tell you, Kemosabe means 'Trusty Scout'.

Name: Mondo ALL CAPS! Pilsner
Description: American-style Pilsner for London's Mondo Brewing Co., showing off a fine balance between corn-like sweetness from the mash bill and full-bodied hoppy bitterness from the Saaz and American Cascade.

Name: Mondo London Alt
Description: The interesting London Alt from Mondo Brewing Co. is a new take on a classic German style of brew - very refreshing, with a good kick of sweetness at the core.

Name: Five Points Pils
Description: Established in Hackney in 2013, The Five Points Brewing Company produce beers that are unfiltered, unpasteurised and pack in lots and lots of flavour.

Name: Five Points Pale
Description: Something of a mash up on all fronts, this is traditional British brewing meets US craft beer movement!

Name: Five Points Hook Island Red
Description: A red rye ale from the talented team at Five Points Brewing Company in Hackney.

Name: Five Points Railway Porter
Description: A coffee-and-chocolate-forward Porter from the Five Points Brewing Co., who are based in Hackney. They brew this tasty tipple using East Kent Golding hops.

Name: Five Points IPA
Description: IPAs (India Pale Ale) were originally conceived to give thirsty British soldiers something to drink when serving in India in the 19th century.

Name: Five Points London Smoke
Description: Originally produced in collaboration with BrewDog Shoreditch, this limited edition Imperial Porter uses smoked barley to create a full flavoured, complex beer.

Name: Savour Sparkling Beer Brut 2016
Description: It's the Savour Sparkling Beer Brut! A tribute to one of nature's greatest gifts (beer!), it's a very traditional saison made using British malt along with Saaz and Motueka hops.

Name: Savour Blonde
Description: Corporate life... or making beer? Corporate life... or making beer?

Name: Savour Saison
Description: A crisp, creamy, flavoursome Saison from Savour, made with Northern Brewer, Crystal and Mittelfruh hops, and there's some lemongrass in there too...

Name: Savour Dubbel
Description: Dubbel-style beer here from Savour, made using a combination of five malts along with a trio of hops (Willamette, Bramling Cross and Rakau) and burnt caramel.

Name: Hiver Honey Ale
Description: Another tasty honey-based brew from the Hiver folks! This one is made with darker roasted malts to their previous expression, as well as fermented raw blossom and heather honeys. Yummers.

Name: Camden Town Hells
Description: Camden Town Hells was the reason the brewers started their very own brewery! They use Perle and Hallertau Tradition hops to make it, as well as Pilsner malt from Bamberg.

Name: Camden Town Gentleman's Wit
Description: Based on a traditional Belgian white (wit) ale, the team at Camden Town Brewery have added lemon zest and bergamot for a fruity, complex beer that goes wonderfully with savoury foods - cheese

Name: Camden Town Pils
Description: A tasty, dry-hopped Pils here from Camden Town Brewery, made with Simcoe, Centennial and Zeus hops. Crack open one of these on a warm summer afternoon and you'll have done well.

Name: Camden Town Pale
Description: Like so many British craft breweries, the team at Camden Town love American Pale Ales, but sometimes find the powerful hop content a bit too full on and hard to drink!

Name: Camden Town IHL
Description: An IPA re-imagined as a lager by the folks at Camden Town Brewery, who arguably kickstarted the craft beer movement in the UK, and are also particularly fond of lager!

Name: Partizan Pale Ale
Description: A constantly evolving beer, this Pale Ale from Partizan has an ever changing hop content, depending as to what is available and in season.

Name: Partizan X Ale - Lovibond 1864
Description: The Partizan Brewery use their X Ale series to explore beer recipes through the ages. This particular edition is a mild, and features DMX and Xena: Warrior Princess on the label.

Name: Partizan Mosaic IPA
Description: Bermondsey's Partizan Brewing make beers that are not only very modern, they are also very drinkable indeed! This IPA shows nice balance between big hop character and sheer, delicious drinkability!

Name: Partizan Porter
Description: A rich, decadent style of Porter from Bermondsey's Partizan Brewing. Big, powerful and tasty!

Name: Signature Brew Studio Pilsner
Description: Crisp, creamy Pilsner from Signature Brew, who started brewing after getting tired of drinking mediocre beers in music venues and wanted change - a noble cause!

Name: Signature Brew Studio Vienna Lager Can
Description: An unfiltered Vienna-style lager from Signature Brew in Leyton. This one packs a hearty punch of Saaz hop bitterness and creamy malt...

Name: Signature Brew Studio Roadie All Night IPA
Description: \"Behind every good show, there's a team of Roadies, and behind every team of Roadies, there's beer\" say the people at musically inspired brewery Signature Brew, and we have no evidence to suggest that

Name: Signature Brew Backstage IPA
Description: In their profession as music marketeers David Riley and Sam McGregor were exposed to a quite possibly dangerous amount of dull, warm and flat beer.

Name: Pressure Drop Wallbanger Wit
Description: Refreshing, summery, generally yummy Belgian-style wheat beer here from the Pressure Drop Brewing folks in Hackney.

Name: Pressure Drop Wu Gang Chops The Tree
Description: An interesting hefeweisse from Pressure Drop made with foraged herbs, created with the intention of creating a beer that would pair well with roast chicken!

Name: Pressure Drop Bosko IPA
Description: Inspired by classic American IPA's, Pressure Drop have characteristically put their own spin on it in their beer Bosko, using crystal malt for a fuller, sweeter flavour profile than is the norm for

Name: Pressure Drop Nanban Kanpai
Description: Pressure Drop created this wheat IPA with Tim Anderson, owner of Brixton's Nanban restaurant - it's made wtih yuzu, orange and grapefruit, which gives it an intense kick of fresh fruit notes.

Name: Pressure Drop India Rubber Ball IPA
Description: A special edition, limited release beer from Pressure Drop, this Citra IPA has been primed with Clementine juice produced by Pressure Drop's neighbours, Square Root Sodas.

Name: Wild Card Jack of Clubs
Description: Tasty ruby ale from the Wild Card Brewery in Walthamstow, combining British Crystal malts with American hops. Smashing stuff.

Name: Wild Card King of Hearts
Description: The King of Hearts from Walthamstow's Wild Card Brewery is a light, scrummy Blonde ale brewed with lager malts and dry-hopped with Citra. Cracking label designs on these ones, too.

Name: Wild Card Queen of Diamonds
Description: Walthamstow's excellent Wild Card Brewery continuously add hops throughout the boil when brewing up their Queen of Diamonds IPA. Well-hopped and refreshing.

Name: Wild Card Ace of Spades
Description: Walthamstow's Wild Card Brewery feature very handsome labels and cracking beers within the bottles! Win/win!

Name: Gipsy Hill Beatnik Pale Ale
Description: Using a malt base of Maris Otter Pale & Cara Gold, Beatnik is the flagship beer from The Gipsy Hill Brewing Company, showing that you can still pack an awful lot of flavour and character into a sub 4%

Name: Gipsy Hill Southpaw Amber Ale
Description: Formed by three beer loving friends in south east London, Gipsy Hill produce beers that are all marked by their sheer drinkability; no huge alcohol or massively concentrated flavours, but everything

Name: Gipsy Hill Hepcat Session IPA
Description: A craft beer featuring a bearded man holding a sign saying \"Hipster\" would just be a little too on the nose wouldn't it?

Name: Brixton Brewery Effra Ale
Description: Named after the River Effra that runs deep underneath London, Brixton Brewery's Effra Ale packs a core of rich malt alongside balancing bundles of hops, including Summit, Pilgrim, Aurora, Northdown,

Name: Brixton Brewery Reliance Pale Ale
Description: \"We reckon that every great neighbourhood deserves a great brewery\" say the founders of Brixton Brewery. Yep, hard to argue with that one.

Name: Brixton Brewery Atlantic APA
Description: Tropical fruit notes abound with the Atlantic APA from Brixton Brewery - they use a combination of Vic Secret, Citra, Simcoe and Galaxy hops to create this one.

Name: Brixton Brewery Electric IPA
Description: Inspired by Brixton's Electric Avenue, the Brixton Brewery Electric IPA is a massively flavoursome brew featuring big whacks of Cascade, Centennial and Amarillo hop deliciousness.

Name: Brixton Brewery Windrush Stout
Description: Deliciously chocolatey stout from Brixton Brewery, founded in 2013.

Name: Vale Amber Lager
Description: Amber Lager from Vale Brewing, designed using Pale, Munich, Crystal and Carafa roasted malt for a full flavoured and complex style of beer.

Name: Vale Lager
Description: Every winemaker knows that you can't survive a harvest without beer. Or in Australia, quite a lot of beer, probably.

Name: Yeastie Boys Gunnamatta Earl Grey IPA Can
Description: It's the Yeastie Boys' award-winning Gunnamatta Earl Grey IPA, now available in a hollow steel cylinder colloquially known as a can!

Name: Alphabet Brewing Hoi Polloi Pilsner
Description: Pilsner for the people... and quite possibly cats, if the somewhat psychedelic artwork on this can from Manchester's Alphabet Brewing Company is to be believed.

Name: Alphabet Brewing Flat White
Description: We'll lay good money that in the time it's taken us to write this, both a coffee shop and a brewery will have opened up somewhere in the UK.

Name: Umbrella Brewing Ginger Beer
Description: An alcoholic ginger beer from London's Umbrella Brewing, made with freshly-pressed ginger, hand-squeezed lemon and demerara sugar. Lovely labels, too.

Name: St-Feuillien 2016 - Limited Edition No.1
Description: A special edition brew by cult Belgian producers Brasserie St-Feuillien, this combines the fresh, fruity qualities of white beer with the complex aromas and spiciness of saisons.

Name: Partizan Stout
Description: Inspired by new wave American beers and frustrated by their lack of availability in the UK (perhaps try Master of Malt next time?

Name: Red Willow Cherry Heartless
Description: Made with over 50kg of cherries per batch, this is a decadent stout for all of those who like to combine their beer with a little chocolate and a relatively large quantity of fruit...

Name: Red Willow Shameless
Description: Yes, it's called Shameless. Yes, it's from the north west of England. However, this has as much to do with the beer Frank drinks as... well, two things in the same family that are distantly related.

Name: Red Willow Sleepless
Description: The brewing scene in the North West has been growing at a seemingly exponential rate over the last few years, so much so that Red Willow, formed only in 2010 in Macclesfield, seem like old

Name: Red Willow Smokeless
Description: Chipotles and beer - what could possibly go wrong with combining the two? Absolutely nothing, I hear you say? Quite right!

Name: Red Willow Weightless
Description: An easy drinking, session IPA from the folks at Red Willow in Cheshire. Lots of lovely fruit and moderate alcohol make this a cracking little beer!

Name: Red Willow Wreckless
Description: A multi award winning (including SIBA National Champion in 2012) Pale Ale from the folks at Macclesfield's Red Willow Brewery.

Name: Marble Brewery Black Sunshine
Description: When not serving thirsty Post Office workers in the bar of the Marble Arch pub in Manchester, Marble Brewery make some very tasty beers!

Name: To Øl First Frontier Can
Description: To Øl's First Frontier, a well-hopped American-style IPA, now available in cans! This is made using a trio of classic IPA hops - Warrior, Simcoe and Centennial.

Name: RTW Royal Best Bitter
Description: From Royal Tunbridge Wells, our beloved home town, Royal is a best bitter beer based on a recipe from the 1980s (the days of yore), this is made with Pale and Crystal malts and Challenger and Goldings

Name: RTW Dipper Bitter
Description: Dipper is a great bitter brewed in none other than our much loved hometown of Royal Tunbridge Wells. It is named for the lady who serves water from the Chalybeate Spring Water on the Pantiles.

Name: RTW Sovereign Blonde
Description: Brewed in glorious Tunbridge Wells (where our headquarters are situated), Sovereign is a light blonde beer made with Kentish Fuggles hops, East Kent Golding and Sovereign hops.

Name: Holly Daze Dark Amber Ale
Description: A dark amber winter warmer of a beer.

Name: RTW Beau Porter
Description: From our very own hometown of Royal Tunbridge Wells! Beau is a fine Porter with notes of coffee, cocoa, liquorice and malt. Brilliant stuff. If you buy this, you're a Beau Selector.

Name: Einstök Icelandic Wee Heavy
Description: A taste of Scottish tradition via Iceland. Scotch ale from Einstök, brewed with smoked, locally farmed barley along with Icelandic angelica.

Name: Chorlton Brewing Co. Märzen Weiße 2017
Description: A German-style wheat beer from the Chorlton Brewing Co., which is unfiltered, unpasteurised and unfined. Always an exciting moment when we get to bust out the \"ß\" letter.

Name: Chorlton Brewing Co. Summer/Blanc Double Sour
Description: A refreshing sour beer from the inventive Chorlton Brewing Co. folks. Ought to make for an interesting summer evening treat.

Name: Alphabet Brewing A to the K
Description: An unusual Oatmeal Pale ale from the team at Manchester's Alphabet Brewing, one of several breweries taking the city by storm.

Name: Bellfield Bohemian Pilsner
Description: The Bellfield Brewery in Scotland is dedicated to creating gluten-free beers to be enjoyed by Coeliacs and people removing gluten from their diet - a noble endeavour!

Name: Bellfield Lawless Village IPA
Description: A gluten-free IPA from the Bellfield Brewery - whom are dedicated to crafting delicious gluten-free beers to everyone to enjoy.

Name: First Chop HOP
Description: An ultra pale ale from Manchester's own First Chop, made with Bobek, Dr. Rudi, Cascade, Chinook and Zeus hops. They always went and dry-hopped it with Citra hops for added oomph.

Name: First Chop PIP
Description: A zesty saison from the First Chop Brewing chaps in Manchester, made with a combination of Motueka and Zeus hops, alongside cold pressed grapefruit oil.  Plus, they're gluten free! Nice!

Name: First Chop POD
Description: First Chop's POD oatmeal stout gets an extra vanilla-y kick by being brewed with vanilla pods! Perfect stuff for enjoying on a cold autumn evening.  Plus, they're gluten free! Nice!

Name: First Chop POP
Description: A juicy, fruity IPA from First Chop Brewing in Manchester, produced using Crystal and Waiti hops.

Name: First Chop SUP
Description: A sessionable IPA from the Manchester-based First Chop crew, made with Dr. Rudi and Rakau hops, and dry-hopped with Mosaic.

Name: Dark Star Crème Brûlée
Description: Never before have we seen a beer so well suited to enjoying as part of a dessert as Dark Star's Crème Brûlée, brewed with unfermentable lactose sugar, vanilla beans and well-roasted malts.

Name: Brasserie de Silly Abbaye de Forest
Description: A Belgian blonde from Brasserie de Silly - sweet with dried fruit and vanilla pod, followed by a kick of hoppy bitterness.

Name: Brasserie de Silly Pils Bio
Description: A light, refreshing Belgian Pils from Brasserie de Silly, made using organic malts and organic hops! Enjoyably crisp and creamy.

Name: Brasserie de Silly Blanche de Silly
Description: Brasserie de Silly's Blanche de Silly is perfect for enjoying on a scorching evening in the middle of summer. They add orange peel and coriander to this one for added tastiness.

Name: De Villée
Description: De Villée is a combination of wheat beer from Brasserie de Silly along with a splash of lemon eau de vie from Distillerie de Biercée.

Name: Brasserie de Silly Green Killer IPA
