Description: Generously hopped IPA from Belgian producers, Brasserie de Silly, whom have been in the business of brewing brill beers since 1850.

Name: Brasserie de Silly Pink Killer
Description: Brasserie de Silly's Pink Killer is a Belgian wheat-based brew made with a lip-smacking helping of grapefruit juice thrown into the mix.

Name: Burning Sky Imperial Stout
Description: Behold the big, burly Burning Sky Imperial Stout! Hugely rich and thick, with a massive kick of dark chocolate at its core.

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Centennial
Description: Pale ale from The Kernel Brewery in London, celebrating the cracking Centennial hop.

Name: The Kernel Pale Ale Citra (with Oats)
Description: Fantastic pale ale from The Kernel in London, brewed with the much-adored Citra hop, along with oats for added creaminess. Hall is nowhere to be seen, however. Shame.

Name: Moor Beer Company PMA
Description: A top pale ale from Moor Beer Company, made with oodles of fruity hops. Not only is it delicious, a portion of Moor Beer Company's profits from PMA is donated to the charity Hardcore Hits Cancer!

Name: Pressure Drop Gesundheit
Description: A German-style wheat IPA from Pressure Drop, brewed with a pair of New Zealand hops - Nelson Sauvin and Motueka. Gawd bless 'em!

Name: Thornbridge Halcyon
Description: Intense imperial IPA incoming! This is the Thornbridge Brewery's Halcyon, boasting a hearty ABV and packing a good wallop of hops.

Name: Thornbridge Valravn
Description: A full-bodied black IPA from the Derbyshire-based Thornbridge Brewery, combining handsome hops with dark malts.

Name: Thornbridge Wild Raven
Description: Hugely impressive black IPA from the Thornbridge Brewery, boasting well-roasted malts and a core of bitter hops.

Name: Time & Tide Calista IPA
Description: An English IPA from Eastry-based Time & Tide Brewing, featuring the smashing flavours of Vic Secret, Ella and Equinox hops.

Name: Time & Tide Double Stout
Description: A burly double stout from Time & Tide Brewing. The two-headed demon cat on the label is somewhat unsettling, but otherwise this is a proper treat.

Name: Weird Beard K*ntish Town Beard
Description: Weird Beard's K*ntish Town Beard is something of a mixture of style - a hearty helping of wheat in the recipe might make you think it leans towards the German Weißbier, but the London-based brewers

Name: Weird Beard Sadako
Description: A hefty imperial stout from the Weird Beard Brew Co., made using a whole host of malts, along with honey, molasses and coffee beans. Very impressive indeed.

Name: Weird Beard Something Something Barrel Aged
Description: A tasty cask-aged IPA brewed with dark malts from London's Weird Beard Brew Co. - [insert subtle reference to well-known space opera franchise here].

Name: Weird Beard Something Something Darkside
Description: Blending dark malts and tasty hops, London's Weird Beard Brew Co. have created a Black IPA that you wouldn't be surprised to see in Chalmun's Cantina...

Name: Mornington Peninsula Lager
Description: From Australias' Mornington Peninsula Brewery comes a German-style lager made with the Tettnang hop. As ever with tasty lagers, chill this tinny thoroughly before cracking it open.

Name: Mornington Peninsula Pale Ale
Description: Australian Pale Ale from Mornington Peninsula Brewery, boasting a full-bodied flavour profile of hops and crisp malt.

Name: Pikes Genuine Stout
Description: A rich stout from Australia-based brewers, Pikes. Fun fact about the pike species of fish: in Finland, to generally be considered a Master Fisherman, you have to catch a pike weighing 10kg.

Name: Pikes Pilsener Lager
Description: Aussie Pilsener Lager from Pikes, based in Clare Valley. They use 100% malted Australian barley to create this refreshing brew.

Name: Prancing Pony Magic Carpet Midnight Ride
Description: A rather weighty but still elegant Imperial Stout from Australia's Prancing Pony Brewery. An incredible indulgence.

Name: Prancing Pony Pagan's Empire
Description: An Australian IPA from the Prancing Pony, brewed with helpings of spelt and rye, alongside a trio of American hops.

Name: Alpine Duet
Description: Amarillo and Simcoe hops sing in harmony within Alpine Beer Company's Duet IPA. Get it. Duet. Harmony. You get it.

Name: Alpine Hoppy Birthday
Description: Do you know a beer fan who just happens to have a birthday? What a coincidence!

Name: Benchmark Brewing IPA
Description: Flavoursome IPA from Benchmark Brewing Co. in San Diego, California. Serve chilled and enjoy the hoppy deliciousness.

Name: Black Market Aftermath
Description: A sessionable IPA from Black Market Brewing, made with a combination of five tasty hops and presented at an approachable ABV.

Name: Cismontane Coulter IPA
Description: An IPA from the Cismontane Brewing Co., named for the Coulter pine tree common in Southern California. The brewers sneaked a morsel of rye into this beer, helping round out the flavour profile.

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. Black Robusto Porter
Description: A rich Porter from Drake's Brewing Co. - thick and chocolatey, with a hint of spicy hops to even out the sweetness. Well-suited to enjoying on a chilly evening.

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. Denogginizer Double IPA
Description: A Double IPA from Drake's Brewing Co. in California.

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. Drakonic
Description: A rich, dark Imperial Stout from Drake's Brewing Co. out in California. Oodles of coffee and chocolate notes to tuck into here.

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. Electric Owl
Description: Owls are among the best variety of birds (just behind puffins and penguins), so why wouldn't you name your tasty brown ale brewed with coffee after them?

Name: Drake's Brewing Co. IPA
Description: A generously well-hopped IPA from Drake's Brewing Co. in San Leandro, California (no relation to the rapper).

Name: Green Flash Sea To Sea Lager
Description: Unfiltered Zwickel Lager from California's Green Flash Brewing Co, made with Hallertau Mittelfrüh and Czech Saaz hops. Poseidon stands watch on the label, trident in hand, protecting his sea.

Name: Green Flash Tangerine Soul Style IPA
Description: A smashing summer sipper from San Diego. Green Flash's Tangerine Soul Style IPA is brewed with Citra and Cascade hops, along with a a helping of tangerine zest!

Name: Mad River Steelhead Extra Pale Ale
Description: What's that coming out from behind the California Redwoods? It's Mad River Brewing's Steelhead Extra Pale Ale, jam packed with lip-smacking hops.

Name: Old Worthy Mr Lyan Lager Passionfruit Pale Ale
Description: Mr Lyan Lager is made by the wonderful folks from Old Worthy in Scotland - it's a passionfruit pale ale, boasting lip-smacking fruity sweetness.

Name: Cigar City Raspberry Halo Imperial Stout
Description: Florida's Cigar City Brewing have gone ahead and combined the rich deliciousness of Imperial Stout with light deliciousness of raspberries in their very own Raspberry Halo.

Name: BrewDog Vs. Beavertown Coffee & Cigarettes
Description: It seemed somewhat inevitable for BrewDog and Beavertown to collaborate, considering that they're two of the UK's most well-loved craft brewers.

Name: Anchor Go West! IPA
Description: A smashing Californian IPA from the ever-dependable Anchor Breweing Co., with a name inspired by the Californian Gold Rush of the mid-1800s.

Name: Anchor Liberty Ale
Description: A tasty pale ale from San Francisco's legendary Anchor Brewing Co., dry-hopped with Cascade hops.

Name: Arrogant Bastard Ale
Description: A rather excellent ale that knows how good it is. Look at that smug can. So very full of itself.

Name: Stone Cali-Belgique IPA
Description: From the Stone Brewing Co. in California comes an American-style Pale Ale with a Belgian twist - they've brewed it with a specially selected strain of Belgian yeast.

Name: Stone Go To IPA
Description: Stone's Go To IPA is filled to the brim with hops (10 different varieties - Ahtanum, Amarillo, Cascade, Chinook, Citra, Crystal, Magnum, Mosaic, Sterling and Hopsteiner 06300), but presented at a

Name: Stone IPA
Description: A full-bodied IPA from the fantastic Stone Brewing Co., featuring a whole truckload of hoppy deliciousness.

Name: Arrogant Bastard Little Bastard Ale
Description: A more approachable (but still rather full-on) American ale from the Arrogant Bastard range. \"Nearly as arrogant as ever\".

Name: Stone Ruination Double IPA
Description: \"A liquid poem to the glory of the hop\" boasts the label of Stone Brewing Co.'s Ruination Double IPA - so it shouldn't be too difficult to guess what to expect this Californian brew to taste like...

Name: Two Roads Honeyspot Road IPA
Description: The Honeyspot Road IPA from Two Roads Brewing Co.

Name: Two Roads Lil' Heaven
Description: We're not sure if Two Roads Brewing Co. took inspiration from the trope of rappers naming themselves \"Lil' Something\" for their Lil' Heaven, but we like to think so.

Name: Two Roads Ol' Factory Pils
Description: A refreshing Pilsner from the Two Roads Brewery in Connecticut, USA.

Name: Two Roads Worker's Comp Saison
Description: A traditionally-styled Saison from Two Roads Brewing Co., showing off lots of fruit and a hearty kick of spice.

Name: Victory Headwaters Pale Ale
Description: Headwaters Pale Ale from Pennsylvania's Victory Brewing Co., filled with Simcoe and Citra hops as well as water from the East Branch of Brandywine Creek. An aptly named water source for this beer...

Name: Victory Prima Pils
Description: A marvellous Pils from Victory Brewing in Pennsylvania, boasting a sizeable helping of hoppy bitterness alongside the refreshing, vanilla-y creaminess.

Name: Victory Vital IPA
Description: Generously-hopped American pale ale, brewing using Pilsner malts and German Kölsch yeast, resulting in a well-balanced flavour profile of bitterness, creaminess, spiciness and general deliciousness.

Name: Victory Hop Devil IPA
Description: Victory Brewing Co.'s Hop Devil combines a trio of 'C' hops (Cascade, Centennial and Chinook), resulting in a punchy IPA with oodles of bitterness behind it.

Name: Berliner Pilsner
Description: A long-running German Pilsner from Berlin, featuring a bear on the label as a reference to berlin's coat of arms. Refreshing stuff.

Name: Brooklyn Brewery Brown Ale
Description: New York's Brooklyn Brewery took inspiration from the beers of England to create their very own Brown Ale - combining the intensity of northern brown ales and rounded sweetness of southern brown ales.

Name: Brooklyn Brewery 1/2 Ale
Description: A splendid Saison from New York's Brooklyn Brewery - perfect for a sunny afternoon, or for pairing with spicy meals.

Name: Brooklyn Brewery Scorcher IPA
Description: A sessionable IPA from the ever-impressive Brooklyn Brewery. Bursting with tasty hops, but presented at an approachable ABV. Good on a scorching hot day, and for pairing with scorching hot foods.

Name: Hitachino Nest Red Rice Ale
Description: Another tasty beer from Kiuchi Brewery's Hitachino Nest range - this time it's an ale which has been brewed with red rice! It's a hoot.\r\n\r\nGet it? Hoot?

Name: Hitachino Nest White Ale Can
Description: What could be better than a Belgian style Japanese witbier? That's right - Belgian style Japanese witbier in a can!

Name: Spencer Trappist Ale
Description: The flagship Trappist ale from the Massachusetts-based Spencer Brewery - America's first Trappist brewery!

Name: Anchor Brotherhood Steam Beer
Description: A dry-hopped California Common beer from the experts at San Francisco's Anchor Brewing Co., made in collaboration with Chris Robinson Brotherhood, a blue rock band from California.

Name: Evil Twin Nomader Weisse
Description: Berliner-style wheat beer from the much-adored Evil Twin Brewing, made at Westbrook Brewing Co. in South Carolina.

Name: Flying Dog Jalapeño White Ale
Description: From Maryland's Flying Dog comes a Belgian-style wheat beer brewed with Jalapeño peppers. Spicy though creamy - a delicious juxtaposition.

Name: Gigantic Holy Oak
Description: A hugely flavoursome collaborative beer made by Gigantic Brewing Co. and the chaps from Magic Rock.

Name: Gigantic Pipewrench IPA
Description: There's three awesome things about this beer from Gigantic. Firstly, it's an IPA that's aged in Ransom Old Tom barrels. Secondly, they've named it Pipewrench. Pipewrench is a great name.

Name: Gigantic Scrilla
Description: While \"Gigantic Scrilla\" would make for a pretty fantastic album title, it's actually a rather smashing IPA from the Gigantic Brewing Co., made with Crystal, Citra and Simcoe hops.

Name: Ayinger Frühlingsbier
Description: A rather traditionally-styled and unfiltered German beer from the Ayinger brewery. Lovely retro label, too.

Name: Hitachino Nest Dai Dai IPA
Description: Japanese IPA here from the Hitachino Nest range, which interestingly has been brewed with a type of wild mandarin to give it a kick of lip-smacking citrus.

Name: Wild Beer Chronos
Description: An interesting combination of styles here from The Wild Beer Co. - Chronos is a lager brewed in a large oak foudre with lager yeast and brettanomyces!

Name: Wild Beer Redwood 2016
Description: The 2016 edition of the Wild Beer Co.'s Redwood, which is made with berries foraged from the hedgerows around the Somerset-based brewery.

Name: Signature Brew Studio Vienna Lager
Description: The creamy though enjoyably punchy Studio Vienna Lager from Signature Brew, who are dedicated to getting their beers into the hands of gig-goers after having to put up with overpriced, bog-standard

Name: Yeastie Boys Pot Kettle Black Can
Description: We love the Yeastie Boys.

Name: Yeastie Boys Bigmouth
Description: A full bodied and refreshing session IPA from the team at Yeastie Boys. Unusually for a New Zealand based brewery, this has been made in the UK, but is still chock full of aromatic Kiwi hops!

Name: Weird Beard Opulence
Description: A limited edition Imperial Stout from Weird Beard in Hanwell, released to celebrate their 400th brew.

Name: First Chop JAM
Description: First Chop JAM may sound like it doesn't really make sense, so let us assure you that it's a beautiful mango-infused pale ale, made by the folk at First Chop Brewing Arm in Manchester.

Name: Cloudwater Mittelfrüh Tettnanger Helles
Description: Mmmmm, tasty Cloudwater Mittelfrüh Tettnanger Helles. Try saying that one quickly.

Name: BrewDog Dead Pony Club Can
Description: It's BrewDog's delicious Dead Pony Club... Now in a can! Simples!

Name: Flying Dog Bloodline
Description: A wonderful special edition ale from Flying Dog, brewed with the peel and juice of blood oranges to give a superb balance between citrus sweetness and pale ale bitterness.

Name: Flying Dog Numero Uno
Description: Flying Dog's tribute to Mexico is one of the best seasonal ales we've come across - what could be better then agave infused beer?!

Name: Erdinger Dunkel
Description: This dark wheat beer was first created by Erdinger's master brewers as a birthday present for the owner in 1989. As ways to kiss up to the boss go, that's pretty awesome.

Name: Erdinger Kristall
Description: Intensely filtered wheat beer from Bavarian specialists Erdinger, with extra sparkling and carbonic acid for a wonderfully refreshing, crystal clear wheat beer.

Name: Erdinger Pikantus
Description: The strongest expression of Erdinger's offering, this dark wheat beer is bottled at a generous 7.3%, and makes for a classic Bavarian aperitif.

Name: Erdinger Urweisse
Description: Dating back to the founding days of the Erdinger brewery in 1886, Urweisse is a classic Bavarian wheat beer - top fermented and generously hopped for a full bodied, distinctive style.

Name: Erdinger Weiss
Description: An all time classic wheat beer - one that's enjoyed by beer lovers all over the world. A top fermented beer matured in the bottle (as they do for Champagne), this is a Bavarian speciality.

Name: Flensburger Gold
Description: Flensburger is the world's biggest user of flip top bottles (every day is a school day, as they say), and they use them to house the tasty beer that comes from Germany's most northerly brewery.

Name: Flensburger Pilsener
Description: Traditionally packaged north German Pilsener from Flensburger, one of the few remaining independent breweries in Germany. We reckon this'll be perfect for sunny afternoons in the garden.

Name: Früh Kölsch Can
Description: Kölsch is a term used to describe beers brewed in and around the city of Cologne, and Früh are perhaps the greatest exponents of this pilsner-esque style.

Name: Helles Schlenkerla Lagerbíer
Description: Classic Helles lager from the folk at Brauerei Heller Bamberg, fermented with the same yeast which is used to produce their legendary smoked beer.

Name: Adnams Southwold Bitter Can
Description: Long summer evenings, cricket on the village green, bitter beer... Enduring image, isn't it? Marvellous.

Name: Adnams Ghost Ship Can
Description: Scarily good (see what we did there?) pale ale from the chaps at Adnams, who have been making beer in Southwold since the Cenozoic era. Or at least, quite a long time.

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Crystal Rye IPA
Description: We've no idea who Jack Brand is, but he and Adnams certainly seem to be making some smashing beers together.

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Dry Hopped Lager Can
Description: The first lager that Adnams have made since they set up in Southwold in 1872. Frankly, we're not sure what took them so long, but this dry hopped expression is certainly worth the wait!

Name: Adnams Southwold Explorer
Description: Established in 1872, Adnams are synonymous with their home of Southwold, but thankfully their beers are now available well beyond their home in Suffolk.

Name: Adnams Tally-Ho 2016
Description: A yearly treat from Southwold's Adnams, their Tally-Ho is a rich cask-aged dark ale which has been brewed yearly since 1880! This is the 2016 vintage.

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Earl Grey Lager
Description: An interesting English lager from Adnams in Southwold, released as part of the Jack Brand range. Using Earl Grey tea in brewing is uncommon, but it has happened before - though mainly with IPA beers.

Name: Bitburger Pils
Description: Bitburger is a brewery steeped in history; founded in 1817 and still family owned, they were the first to produce a Pilsener style beer outside of its traditional home of Bohemia, and have gone on to

Name: Pressure Drop Cast Iron Billy
Description: Cast Iron Billy is an imperial brown stout based on an 1832 recipe from Barclay Perkins Brewery, designed to hearken back to Victorian London, in the midst of the Industrial Revolution. At 10.

Name: Buxton Brewery Ice Cream Pale Ale
Description: A combination of two amazing things - beer and ice cream!

Name: Roosters Pilsnear
Description: A seasonal special from Roosters Brewery in North Yorkshire, this is a cross between a pilsner and pale ale; made with German and Czech hops and Pilsner and Munich malts, but with a touch more fruit

Name: Alphabet Brewing Charlie Don't Surf
Description: Charlie don't surf, but it certainly looks like these kittens on this snazzily designed can are considering it. \"We love the smell of IPA in the morning... Smells like... Well, beer.

Name: Vocation Pure Pilsner
Description: Classic Czech style Pilsner from West Yorkshire brewery Vocation, made with traditional Pilsner malt and European hops.

Name: St-Feuillien Saison
Description: Traditional Belgian farmhouse ale from Brasserie St-Feuillien, which undergoes secondary fermentation in the bottle, thus creating a full bodied, spicy ale.

Name: And Union Unfiltered Lager Can
Description: Those folks at And Union know what they're doing, as evidenced by this full-flavoured old-school lager. Brewed for six weeks, the malty drop is the ideal companion for meat, seafood and spicy snacks.

Name: And Union Sunday Pale Ale Can
Description: An easy sipper from And Union, bursting at the seams with refreshing tropical fruits and a resinous mouthfeel. As the team says, 'don't let Mondays ruin your Sundays'.

Name: Yeastie Boys Digital IPA Can
Description: A classic Kiwi IPA from the New Zealand-based Yeastie Boys team. An ode to classic IPA, Digital is made with late kettle hopping and very little dry hopping resulting in a clean, bold drop.

Name: Howling Hops IPA New England Special
Description: Brewed in a large Victorian warehouse in London's Hackney Wick, Howling Hops IPA New England Special is a blend of Mosaic, Motueka and Citra hops which combine for a juicy pour on the sweeter side.

Name: Anchor Steam Beer Dry Hopped
Description: Anchor Steam Beer is one of the most well known American craft beers around.

Name: Brooklyn Summer Ale Can
Description: A refreshing pale ale all the way from Brooklyn, made with a quartet of popular hops including Cascade, Amarillo, Ahtanum and Willamette.

Name: Flying Dog Summer Rental Radler
Description: A easy-drinking beer from Flying Dog, based around a lager recipe and brewed with grapefruit and passion fruit.

Name: Hitachino Nest Ginger Ale
Description: A refreshing, zesty Ginger Ale from Japan's Hitachino Nest range.

Name: Weird Beard Sour Rangers
Description: There's plenty to love about Weird Beard Sour Rangers, so we've made a little list to make things a bit simpler.\r\n1. It's a terrifically tart apricot Berliner Weisse style brew.\r\n2.

Name: Beavertown Tempus Project Barrel Aged Applelation
Description: A barrel-aged edition of Beavertown's Applelation Bramley Apple Saison, released for their very exciting Tempus range.

Name: Gipsy Hill Ranger Pale Ale
Description: From south east London's Gipsy Hill Brewing Company comes their Ranger Park Pale Ale - the perfect treat for enjoying during a sunny picnic.

Name: Brouwerij De Molen Sun & Moon
Description: A very intriguing collaboration of Brouwerij de Molen in The Netherlands and Tempest Brewing. Sun & Moon is an Umami Imperial Stout brewed with Shitake, miso and salted seaweed!

Name: Uiltje F*ck The Caravan is on Fire!
Description: If owls are so super smart, how come this one set its caravan on fire? Also, who allowed an owl to buy a caravan? Also also, where did this owl learn such filthy language?!

Name: Uiltje Grandma’s Cooking Recipe Vol. 2
Description: No one cooks like Grandma - specially if she's an anthropomorphic Dutch owl with a penchant for cakes and beer. From Uiltje Brewing in The Netherlands comes Grandma’s Cooking Recipe Vol.

Name: Kees Raspberry Cream Ale
Description: Brouwerij Kees and Cloudwater put their heads together to create this lip-smacking Raspberry Cream Ale! Just the ticket for picnics and pudding pairings...

Name: Brouwerij De Molen Magic & Tricks
Description: A particularly punchy double IPA, collaboratively made by Dutch brewers Brouwerij De Molen and Huddersfield's very own Magic Rock Brewing.

Name: Uiltje Sunshine? Yes Please!
Description: Sessionable Dutch IPA from Uiltje Brewing in Haarlem. As you might expect from its name, this one is perfect for enjoying on a bright evening in the summer.

Name: Five Points Citrus Pale
Description: A collaboration between The Five Points Brewing Company and Field Day, this citrus pale ale will feature one of Astrid, Ludo, Noodles, Polly and Scooby on each can.

Name: BrewDog Hop Fiction Can
Description: BrewDog's Hop Fiction, now available in a can! Get your grubby mitts on one of these metallic cylinders if you're the sort of person that likes their beers with intensely fruity hop notes.

Name: BrewDog Electric India Can
Description: A blend of beer styles from Scotland's BrewDog - their Electric India expression blurs the lines between American IPA and Belgian saison, and also features helpings of heather honey and crushed

Name: BrewDog Nine to Five Wizard
Description: Some people say that those chaps from BrewDog are wizards. There might be a touch of truth to that, and their Nine to Five Wizard is perhaps an admission of wizardly-ness.

Name: Wild Beer Rooting Around (Summer)
Description: Rooting Around Summer is a barrel aged sour beer from Somerset’s The Wild Beer Co. brewed for a chosen season.

Name: Uiltje Hoi Dit Is Hop
Description: Single hop Pale Ale from Uiltje in The Netherlands. The name literally translates to \"Hi, this is hop\

Name: Beavertown & Firestone West Side Beavo
Description: Beavertown & Firestone West Side Beavo is a one-off collaboration by brew-masters Logan Plant and Matt Brynildson.

Name: Roosters Roots. Rock. Reggae.
Description: Roosters Roots. Rock. Reggae. is an IPA that’s challenges the senses with a 6.

Name: To Øl !PA: Citra & Mosaic
Description: A few of you probably have no idea what any of the words in the name of this drink means. It's OK. Here's what you do.

Name: Brew York Little Eagle
Description: Brew York Little Eagle is a beer that looks to break the mould, boasting a full body and punchy flavour with only 4.5% ABV.

Name: Brew York X-Panda
Description: Using the same Brew York core malt recipe, X-Panda is the result of hop-heavy experimentation and combinations to create this session IPA that ranks at 4.5% ABV.

Name: First Chop MCR
Description: Modern Manchester bitter brewed at 4.4% for the Manchester Beer Festival in 2015, this can is given the classic First Chop treatment - it's packed full of hops and is gluten-free.

Name: First Chop RED
Description: This First Chop RED is, wait - you guessed it, a red ale from First Chop Brewing Arm.

Name: First Chop SYL
Description: SYL is Black IPA that's gluten-free and teaming with hops, which means it could only be from Salford-based brewers First Chop.

Name: Magic Rock Amanecer Mexicano
Description: Part of the 2017 Rainbow Project, Magic Rock Amanecer Mexicano was inspired by the colour red and the style and sensibilities of Casita Cerveceria, a brewery that’s all about Mexican-style beer.

Name: Magic Rock Fantasma
Description: This particularly excellent Citra IPA from Magic Rock Brewing in Huddersfield combines hops bittered with Magnum in its trusty kettle and Citra T90, bittered in the whirlpool and in dry-hopping.

Name: Moor Beer Company Return of the Empire
Description: Moor Beer Company's Return of the Empire showcases the Jester hop - a newcomer in the world of hops, and a particularly tasty one at that!

Name: Weird Beard Master of Nuggets
Description: A single hop brown ale from the Weird Beard Co., produced using the nugget hop variety. Particularly spicy and lively - not exactly what you're expecting from a brown ale.

Name: Mikkeller Raspberry Trippelbock Barrel Aged
Description: Those Mikkeller chaps have taken their Mikkeller Raspberry Trippelbock and aged it!

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Dry Hopped Lager
Description: Given that this was the first lager ever brewed at Adnams, it was important to the brand that years of experience was applied to create something that stood apart from regular lager - a beer that

Name: American Craft IPA Gift Pack
Description: This handy flavour of American craft brewing comes with 8 cans of craft IPA!

Name: Hitachino Nest White Ale Gift Pack (3 x 35cl)
Description: From Kiuchi Brewery, Hitachino Nest White Ale is created in the form of traditional Belgian style white beer with a refreshing, mildly hopped and complex flavour.

Name: Hofbräu Original Gift Pack with Stein
Description: Brilliant Bavarian beer, with a stein to match. This gift pack from Hofbräu München contains four 50cl bottles of their Hofbräu Original lager alongside a branded stein to enjoy said beer from!

Name: BrewDog Hoppy Christmas
Description: Those chaps at BrewDog know exactly what you want to find wrapped up under the Christmas tree - beer! They've made their very own festive IPA named Hoppy Christmas (Ho ho ho - very clever!

Name: BrewDog Abstrakt AB:23
Description: The latest Abstrakt release is an American barley wine that spent nearly two years maturing in bourbon whiskey casks in the BrewDog Ellon barrel store, bringing out an array of flavours and textures

Name: BrewDog Hop Shot
Description: Hop Shot is an experiment in ice-distillation, with Antarctic temperatures applied to the brew, concentrated by removing any ice that forms.

Name: Gipsy Hill Karoshi Double IPA
Description: The first solo Double IPA from Gipsy Hill, Karoshi is a composition of organic yeast strain from Portland blended with a wild saccaromyces strain and El Dorado, Mouteka and Nelson Saving hops.

Name: Moor Beer Company JJJ
Description: While this IPA was created in Bristol’s Moor Brewery, founder and head brewer Justin Hawke was actually joined by James & Josh from the Queen’s Arms, Corton Denham, to craft this effort, hence the

Name: Stillwater A Saison Darkly
Description: Even though Stillwater Artisanal Ales are based in Maryland, United States, this dark saison was brewed at Sint Canarus, a house brewery in Gottem, Belgium in association with brewmaster mister Piet

Name: Thornbridge Days of Creation
Description: Days of Creation is the second iteration of a project Thornbridge have been working on for a number of years, one to create a modern sour ale, aged in barrels, that possessed the depth and range of

Name: Curious Brew
Description: You may know the folks from English winery Chapel Down for their fantastic selection of sparkling wines, but they've also got some other sparkling treats for you to enjoy - namely, beer!

Name: Curious IPA
Description: Not happy with the beers available on the market, the folks from Chapel Down winery in Kent decided there was just one thing for it - they'd better make their own!

Name: Curious Porter
Description: This beautiful nutty black beer is brewed using classic English hops; Bramling Cross and Challenger and chocolate malt, which are then matured with winemakers vanilla oak chips.

Name: Paulaner Münchner Hell 33cl
Description: This little guy is the handy-sized companion to the classic Munich lager from Paulaner Brauerei, the 500ml Paulaner Münchner Hell, also stocked at MoM towers (because we're awesome).

Name: Früh Kölsch
Description: A refreshing, clear and unpasteurised ale with a style distinctive to Cologne, 'Kölsch', which is protected by law.

Name: BrewDog Punk IPA Can
Description: This fresh, full-flavoured natural beer is a tribute to classic IPAs, the post modern twist of the addition of fruity hops adds tropical fruit to the sharp bitter finish of this 5.

Name: Brewdog Kingpin Lager Can
Description: The Kingpin lager is cold-condition and brewed with Magnum and Perle hops along with Cara, Munich, Pale and Pilsner malts for an ambitious and delicious larger.

Name: Howling Hops New Zealand Special
Description: A small batch IPA aimed at showcasing the range of bold, tasty hops that are available in New Zealand, this little beauty is packed with Riwaka, Motueka and Kohatu hops and is bursting with flavour.

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Clementine Pale Ale
Description: A limited edition beer from the folk at Adnams, Clementine Pale Ale is the result of an experiment by head brewer Fergus Fitzgerald.

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Mosaic Pale Ale
Description: A dream of a beer, Adnams Mosaic Pale Ale is bold and fruity, yet with a dry finish bursting with cereal loveliness.

Name: Adnams Sole Star
Description: If you fancy cutting down your alcohol consumption a bit but don't fancy completely eliminating tasty beer from your life, Adnams have just the thing for you - Sole Star!

Name: Adnams Broadside
Description: The classic Adnams Broadside, which was first brewed in 1972 to commemorate the battle of Sole Bay fought against the Dutch Republic in 1672, three hundred years earlier, just off the Southwold coast,

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Innovation IPA
Description: Adnams’ interpretation of an American IPA, made with wheat and pale ale malts alongside hops from England, Slovenia and America (specifically Boadicea, Columbus and Stryian Goldings).

Name: Adnams Triple Knot
Description: This boldly flavoured Belgian-style Tripel is Adnams personal take on a traditional style that combines strong flavour and subtle mouth-feel, packaged in a rather sultry, dark swing-top

Name: Adnams Ghost Ship
Description: As a particularly cowardly paranormal investigator with a penchant for oversized green t-shirts world say, \"It's a g... g... ghost!\" A Ghost Ship, technically.

Name: Adnams Lighthouse
Description: Adnams Lighthouse is based on the recipe of the brewery's former award-winning beer, ‘Champion Pale Ale’.

Name: Adnams Southwold Bitter
Description: An Adnams classic - their Southwold Bitter is the perfect thing for enjoying on a long summer afternoon.

Name: Adnams Blackshore Stout Can
Description: Marvellous stout from Adnams in Southwold, made with a tantalising selection of malts, including pale ale, brown, chocolate, double roasted crystal and roasted barley.

Name: Stillwater Wavvy
Description: A smashing America double IPA deom Sillwater in Baltimore, made with a rotating host of hops. Particularly intense and... Well, it's very hoppy indeed.

Name: Stillwater Spaced
Description: A sessionable pale ale from the fine folks over in Baltimore at Stillwater. They brew this beer using spelt and wheat, which gives it an interesting, creamy mouthfeel.

Name: Stillwater Levadura
Description: An intriguing gose from Baltimore's Stillwater - they call it a Oaxacan-style gose, brewed with agave, lime and salt. You can clearly see where the inspiration came from, can't you?

Name: Stillwater Shoegaze
Description: Sillwater's Shoegaze pale ale blends the traditional bitterness of the aforementioned pale ale style with the creamy goodness of a farmhouse saison within one tasty beer.

Name: Stillwater Stateside Saison Can
Description: A deliciously creamy saison from Baltimore's Stillwater. To make it, they've used a mixture of hops originating from new Zealand as well as hops grown stateside.

Name: Stillwater Superhop
Description: \"Neo-Tropic India Pale Ale\" is how this Stillwater beer describes itself.

Name: Stillwater Insetto
Description: An intriguing blend of styles going on here with Sillwater's Insetto. It's firstly a sour ale brewed with Italian plum, but then they've gone and dry-hopped it afterwards!

Name: Founders DKML
Description: Michigan's Founders Brewing have taken the often misunderstood malt liquor beer style and given it a twist with dry-hopping and letting it age in bourbon barrels.

Name: BrewDog Jack Hammer Can
Description: BrewDog have managed to fit their full-on, all-out hop explosion Jack Hammer IPA into a can! Useful for those of you that prefer metallic cylinders to glass ones...

Name: Brouwerij De Molen Heaven & Hell - Bowmore Barrel Aged
Description: The creation of Brouwerij De Molen, a progressive craft brewery located in Bodegraven, the Netherlands; this characterful imperial stout packs an almighty punch since it contains twice the amount of

Name: Brouwerij De Molen Hemel & Aarde - Bowmore Barrel Aged
Description: An excellent cask-aged stout from Brouwerij De Molen in The Netherlands.

Name: Atom Pulsar Pilsner
Description: Atom's Pulsar takes the classic styling on German Pilsner and combines it with interesting hoppy top-notes from a newer hop variety - Saphir.

Name: Atom Catalyst APA
Description: An enjoyably punchy APA from brewing folks Atom in Hull. Propelled by a love of science and beer, they've created some marvellous brews named after various scientific odds and sods.

Name: Atom Phobos & Deimos Rye IPA
Description: Boasting a hop-heavy flavour profile from the tasty trifecta of summit, centennial and chinook, this dry-hopped rye-based IPA from Atom has a lot going for it.

Name: Atom Quantum State IPA
Description: The Quantum State IPA is a sessionable brew from Atom in Hull featuring a star-studded cast of top-notch hops, including citra, cascade, centennial, columbus and chinook.

Name: Atom Zymology
Description: An intriguing dry-hopped kettle sour beer from Hull's Atom, made using Lactobacillus plantarum as well as mosaic hops, resulting in a balanced flavour profile of in-your-face bitterness and

Name: Brooklyn Summer Ale
Description: A fantastic summer sip from the Brooklyn Brewery, produced using a mixture of hops - Cascade, Amarillo, Ahtanum and Willamette. Immensely refreshing, even when it isn't summer!

Name: Magic Rock Dancing Bear
Description: Yorkshire favourites Magic Rock are well-versed in beers of all styles, including the ever popular lager - as evident by the Dancing Bear German lager!

Name: Adnams Jack Brand Satsuma Witbier
Description: A fancypants new limited-edition beer from the brilliant Adnams, Satsuma Witbier is fabulously fruity and an absolute must-try.

Name: Kees Session IPA
Description: From one of the most unique and interesting creators of beer in the Netherlands comes a Session IPA - it's a 3.5% ABV, bottle conditioned edition that was brewed with Cascade, Mosaic and Summit hops.

Name: Brouwerij De Molen Haken & Ogen
Description: Haken & Ogen is an aged imperial stout matured in a mix of ex-bourbon barrels for close to 12 months, imparting a fascinating array of flavour and a rich personality.

Name: Northern Monk Dark Neapolitan
Description: A rich porter from Northern Monk Brew Co., inspired by ice cream (one of the best desserts you can pick - second only to cake). Grab a spoon.
